text: We did the tour which really didn't let you inside any of the buildings, but was worth it just to get some of the stories about Harvard.  The tours are run by students, and also some of the Harvard gift shops help subsidize students.  The town has a very pretty setting and lots of brick buildings - reminds me a bit of an English setting.  We were there while they were practicing for the Cambridge Regatta and it was fun to watch the rowing boats on the river.  We walked all along the river's edge on both sides.

title: Loved it!!!
text: Everyone was very welcoming at the campus and we were excited to have so many options (self-guided tours, explore on your own and free guided tours).  We explored on our own and were very impressed with how friendly and helpful everyone was, and how accessible the campus was.  The kids left wanting to attend when they grow up!

title: Harvard University tour - don't do it
text: It turned out to be a complete waste of time. A student tasked to lead the tour was really trying but without an access into the buildings the tour is overstretched and full of unnecessary details. Just check a Wikipedia page and do it on your own within 1/2 hour or so.

title: Good for architects
text: The Harvard campus is a compilation of buildings designed by great architects in the history of this field. I recommend going with someone who knows where is each building and its author.

title: Great historic campus
text: Beautiful buildings to see. Very few can you go into without an escort but the grounds are free to roam.

title: boston delights
text: took the tour bus through Harvard and the university area. What an awesome experience, some of the finest buildings I have seen on my visit as well as beautiful American homes

title: Trademark tours
text: This tour group is AWESOME run by students and James was AWESOME had is laughing and his knowledge was unbelievable wow I was just amazing... Harvard is a beautiful University and I have been wanting to visit for a long time... it is a must see when in Boston, fall time was beautiful the colours are amazing here

title: One of the most famous university in the world
text: Is a little bit far from Boston center but was exciting to see one of the most famous university in the world.

title: It makes you feel 100% smarter
text: What a fantastic place to visit. It's one of the centres of learning in the world. The history of the place is amazing and well worth a visit.

title: A must
text: Do a guided tour, typically given by the harvard students themselves! They are inexpensive, and gives you all the information you need about the history of the university. It is older than the country itself! Fun fact!

title: A lovely area to walk around
text: Spent a morning walking around the lovely grounds of the University buildings in the sunshine. Enjoyed a picnic outside the famous Law School.  Cambridge town is also interesting - lots of monuments and a small, busy shopping centre.  Easy access on the subway.

title: Amazing in it's beauty
text: One of the most impressing universities I have ever seen. My advice is to take some 3-4 hours and just walk through the buildings, the libraries and gardens.

title: Historic and iconic.  A tad disappointing, but worth seeing
text: It's hard for Harvard to live up to its reputation, and it's not the most beautiful of college campuses.   For that, go to Princeton.   Or Cornell.  But there's so much history here and so many genial and friendly students.   A must see.

title: Beautiful
text: The lawn is lush and the kids had a great time running around. The library building is beautiful and inspiring. There are a lot of tourists taking pictures so it's hard to get one alone. There are walking tours as well.

title: Only stroll outside the buildings since no entry to either one
text:
The place is very beautiful. Old buildings with great architecture, nice trees and grass outside, but there you should stay.
There'sno entry to the buidings unless you have a Harvard employees or students card. Very disappointing.

title: Interesting tour!
text: If not the most famous, it is probably top three most famous universities in the world and it was great to be able to drive around and use Waze to locate the buildings we had interest in seeing. The university is quite spread out and finding parking is an impossible task if you don’t have a local permit. But driving around already gave us a chance of seeing how the lucky few get their education, how they live, etc.

title: Campus
text: Fall is a great time to visit. It is a campus city. Great historic place. Bring warm clothes if you are here

title: Undergraduate side blends into Cambridge - an interesting bubble
text: The Undergraduate side - VERY old for a US institution - becomes a bubble from the surrounding and quite busy Cambridge square area. Big crowd in front of famous statue. Still an amazing place.

title: De-centralised Campus
text: Lack of campus feeling because of the decentralisation of the campus buildings. The Co-Op store is a must visit store for buying Harvard stuff.

title: Great Tour
text: We did the Harvard tour and i would recommend it. really great guide who was a student and it is definitely worth a visit

title: For a history buff, taking a tour is informative and fun.
text: I enjoyed our tour of Harvard for it's historical context - from its mid-1600 formation and famous alumni, to its alliance with Radcliffe College, to the 1999 change in diplomas for female students.  One thing that really struck me though was just how many tourists were on the campus.  The Harvard Yard between all the freshmas dorms was filled with tourists, not students throwing Frisbees, on a beautiful, warm, Thursday afternoon.

title: Fascinating Student Led Walking Tour
text: My husband and I visited Harvard in October. We attended the student led walking tour. Although not permitted inside the buildings, the student guided us through a walking tour to visit several buildings while also sharing anecdotes and history about Harvard. The tour guide was able to share unique perspective about student life on campus. I would highly recommend.

title: Beautiful,historic campus
text: The campus and the buildings are amazing.  The charm and history of the location is inspiring.  A must see if you are in the Boston area.

title: Culturally rich
text: I would recommend going to hks, Harvard yard weidner library and the museums to soak in the culture.

title: Nice campus
text: Very nice and green Campus. Building are interesting and give a good impression of the university. Definitely need to see John Harvard statue

title: A must visit but not open for tourism
text: Visitors aren't allowed to go into any buildings which may be good for the studens and faculty. But it doesn't feel welcoming compared to other campusses. So while it does feel nice to on the famous Harvard campus, there's nothing really to do there.

title: Easy to visit from Boston
text: We took a tube to Harvard and spent an hour and a half wandering about. It is completely open, and there is a lot to see. We really enjoyed it. Definitely worth a trip.

title: Harvard University Campus
text:
An absolutely fantasitic experience, I suspect some would be put, but please don't be, if your visiting Boston, make a day of it. The arts museum are stunning, you can spend hours looking over some priceless exhibits.

The food in the museum was excllent as were the staff.

The centre is also excellent, as is the Harvard Book Shop.

title: "hahvahd" student led walking tour
text: Entertaining and informative tour of the Harvard yard.  Our guide Kyle was knowledgeable and offers some insight in amusing anecdotes.   Advance reservations may be needed in the summer months,  we were able to buy a ticket right before the tour in early October.

title: A Classic Historical Stop
text: You have to go to Harvard.  You can't say you visited Boston and didn't go.  It's an easy trek on the subway and an easy walk to Harvard Yard.  It's a lovely campus.  Once you've had enough, walk over to the Charles Hotel, use the bathroom, and have lunch or a drink.

title: Official tour by Harvard student
text: Official tour by Harvard student organized through the Harvard information office near Harvard yard. Great ovierview of the campus.

title: Student guided tour of Harvard Yard
text: Visited while the university was in session. Our guide called Alexander was leading his first tour. He gave us lots of information, was happy to answer questions. and offered about ten minutes over the scheduled hour. There were many tourists on the day of the visit, most on guided visits but others simply strolling through. As a student I might have resented such intrusion, but on the day I was delighted to have the opportunity to see for myself the world renowned campus. I recommend booking via the official university website.

title: Weekend in Boston
text: If you're in this area I would recommend you go & see this most historic place of learning.  Beautiful classic red brick buildings surround atmospheric lawns & communal areas. It is everything you'd expect it to be.

title: A wonderful experience
text: A visit to Harvard University plops you right in the middle of its storied history. Walking through Harvard Yard you're able to soak in the feeling of education at its finest. You just get the feeling that, "if only those buildings could talk..."

title: A bit disappointed
text: After hearing the magnificence of this campus, I was a bit disappointed - I expected a greatest area for the campus and I didn't think it was located "downtown" Cambridge. It is interesting to walk around. I preferred the MIT.

title: Interesting just to walk around
text: Been here before and done the Guided tour.Just wandered about on a sunny September day and enjoyed the relaxed ambience of the campus and the fabulousness of the red brick university.

title: Great art museum
text:
Everything from ancient Egypt to Modernism over four floors. A cafe would be a welcome addition. 
It's like walking through an art history course

title: A student tour
text: Spending an hour of your time to get the inside knowledge of this historic university is well worth it. The student guide was very humorous and good fun..

title: History and green spaces
text: Who doesn't know Harvard? You can join various tours being offered or just stroll inside the campus by yourself.

title: Visit to Harward
text: Visited Harvard campus yesterday. Impressive campus. Learned about the myths of the statue of Mr Harvard, founder of university. Chintan explained the campus its history very well. The library has one of the largest collection of Sanskrit books. Five storey underground storage of books.

title: Didn't disappoint
text:
We had an informative and often funny tour of Harvard. Heather was a great guide and her many puns made everyone smile. After the tour we sat out in "the Yard" because it was a beautiful day. 

Hint: the tour starts at little self-standing building in Harvard Square. I state this because the address given of 1376 Mass. Avenue might lead you to think it's next door to the bank.

title: Pleasant meander
text: This made a complete contrast to MIT. Interesting to walk around the campus, dawdle, admire the historical and sit in the sun

title: Nice!
text:
So after visiting Harvard, I can say that I've been in Harvard.
But if you want to go into the buildings you need a harvard pass, which only students, teachers and Co are getting.

Btw It's a very nice place.

title: You could even feel your I.Q. increasing...
text: Don't miss this one when visiting Boston as you would get to roam around in one of the famous universities in the world. Just take note that some areas are prohibited to outsiders. The university is a relaxing place to stroll and if you are lucky, you could spot some events open for other people.

title: Not to be missed when in Boston.
text: As usual when in Boston, Harvard university is a place to visit where produced the most US presidents etc. Enjoy the stroll surround Harvard university. By the way, d breakfast shop here quite good too.

title: You have to
text: How can you come to Cambridge and not visit Harvard ?   It's fun to walk around and just take in the history and beAuty of the campus.

title: What can I say? it's Harvard!!!
text:
Many more talented have described it before me. Read them, The Coop library proposes many books in Harvard.

You can take a tour guided by students.

The best experience is not to visit it but to study there.

title: A must see/do when in Cambridge.
text: A must see/do when in Cambridge.I always like to walk around the grounds and since I was there with my college aged daughter last week during orientation, we were able to mingle with the excited and anxious new Harvard and MIT students walking to and fro to classes.  It was exciting.  Anyone can go to the "Harvard yard" and sit and relax.

title: Good campus tour
text: We attended an information session followed by a campus tour led by a student. Both were good but the tour is outdoors, only.

title: History Palpable
text: An interesting place for a sunny day stroll. Unique historical architecture. The Peabody Museum provides an interesting stop with all the collections. Worth a stop but wouldn't go too far afield for a visit

title: Interesting visit
text: We walked about one hour from Boston to Harvard University and on our way we got a good overview of Cambridge. After our walk we were just pausing some time in the  courtyard and watched the students. We also visited some of the buildings and the nice farmer market next to the premises. There are some good bookshops in the near neighborhood.

title: Harvard
text: Who wouldn't want to step foot there? Went to a couple of their museums and also enjoyed a free concert on the grounds. Peeked into a couple of classrooms. Beautiful old buildings.

title: I may be biased - - -
text: - - - because I got a few degrees there, but just strolling through Harvard Yard (the original center of things) is a lovely experience: tall trees, old building, and fellow strollers from all over the world make it a unique "promenade."

title: Underwhelmed
text: Had some time to kill one morning.  Decided to visit the "great" Harvard University.  Was very underwhelmed.  Students were just arriving for new school year.  Everything was locked down.  Campus is neither very pretty, nor well cared for.

title: Wowed
text: Visited this university as a teenager in our party wants to go to school here. We are all completely WOWed by the beauty of this place and how spectacular it is. (If you are a tourist go to the Harvard coop for all sorts of Harvard souvenirs!)

title: Interesting morning
text: We had a very nice guide called Abel  and we enjoyed the tour. He made it very interesting and had some good stories to tell. We would like to have seen more of the buildings and inside the library but the tour was outside only. We were a little underwhelmed actually but it was definitely worth doing.

title: Very Interesting
text: We took a taxi over to Cambridge and although you can get the students to give you a guided tour we walked around on our own and it was interesting and awe inspiring.  There are students all over the place this time of year because it was orientation week so it was a perfect time to get the 'feel' of the place.

title: nice hop on bus stop and walk to the Natural History museum
text: Walk from the bus stop to the Natural History Museum through the main part of the campus. We like the museum, the glass flowers and the dinosaur and whale exhibits.

title: I'm so glad we went!
text: Our family of four including two teenagers decided to go see Harvard during a recent trip to Boston & I'm so glad we did.  Cambridge itself is a great area with lots of energy.  Initially, we were going to tour Harvard on our own, but decided to book a tour with Hahvahd Tours which are led by Harvard undergraduate students.  We are so glad we decided to go with the tour.  We learned so much more than we would have exploring on our own.  Our tour guide Cormac was entertaining & really did a great job of providing history & insight into a Harvard undergraduate experience.

title: Harvard
text: We walked through the campus and marvelled at the beautiful setting; it must be wonderful to have the opportunity to attend this university.

title: Nice walk around...
text: Very Nice area with old buildings and interesting History.  Lotd of toung people around their books, working on their things ... good spirit for a teenager... ;-)

title: Beautiful ...
text: Its a college of repute and is also a place worth visiting. The architecture, spaces , library etc will leave you transported to a different world..Back to college !

title: Enjoyable visit
text: We visited on moving in day so lots of activity going on!! There are walking tours available but we chose to wander around ourselves. Lots of interesting buildings and a good insight into life on campus! Even got to hear the band!!

title: Exciting to visit this world class educational institute
text: Self guided walking tour takes one around all historical landmarks around Harvard Square. It mainly covers the staying quarters and the huge Widener Library.

title: Impressively
text:
Great mix of old and young. The place where everyone want to learn and work on self.
Stunning huge area with parks, avenues and monuments.

title: Well worth a look around
text: I have been to Boston numerous times and never made it to Harvard so this trip we decided to go. Whilst we were looking at the maps and different tours available we were approached by a gentleman who offered to give us a tour. In return he asked that we pay him what we felt his tour was worth. A few other people were also taking him up on his offer and so we joined them. He was very informative of the area and took us to various places in and around the university. The grounds are stunning and I was very pleased we had made the effort to visit. There is so much history in the area and so many stories that I would say, don't just get a map. Get a tour guide. They are worth the 10 bucks or so that you will pay. Without them, you will not get the full experience.

title: Audio guide tour available
text: When you visit http://www.harvard.edu/on-campus/visit-harvard/tours/audio-tours you can download a series of audio files prepared by recent Harvard grads. That, combined with a walking tour map make for a great combination to successfully tour the university. I highly recommend it.

title: Beautiful campus with SO much history!!
text: I would highly recommend touring the Harvard campus! It is such a beautiful campus, especially Harvard Yard and the buildings along the river. So much interesting history. The campus has very knowledgable, charismatic tour guides. Well worth the visit!

title: Harvard University tour is a must.
text: If visiting Cambridge and not a Yale or Princeton Alumnus, I would suggest you take the Harvard University Tour.  It costs $12, lasts about 10 minutes and is led by a Harvard underclassman.  Our guide was Carmack(?) and he was great.  True, many of his jokes must be told by all the guides but his presentation reminded me of a stand up comic who is dying on stage, pretty hilarious.  The tour goes into the history of the school, notable students, etc.  What I found interesting was that we visited just before the start of school.  It was pretty funny how the new Freshmen were welcomed by current undergrads.  They surrounded the "lost and confused" Freshmen and struck out in a loud/energetic sound and dance routine.  I only wished that I was welcomed like that on my first campus day as a Freshmen.

title: Take your kids!
text:
We hoped that at least one of our three children would be inspired to return here for a longer stay. But they just were not. Anyway, it was great to see the Harvard buildings, the students and the beautiful Cambridge surroundings. 
We left happy and gay because there were a lot of Pokémons to be found.

title: Family visit
text: Great walking tour.  So clean and full of history.  So many shops around the area and cute restaurant options.  Nice place to spend an afternoon or evening

title: Explore by foot
text:
Harvard is a great place to explore by foot. Give yourself a half a day to explore on your own or with a tour. The architecture is old, classical and conservative. Very different from MIT. If you'd like to take a tour, free student tours are offered by the Harvard Information Center located at 1350 Massachusetts Ave. Be sure to check the online calendar for tour dates and times. It's not always offered.

Alternatively, you can pay for a 90 minute tour through a private company who hire students. This cost $10 and is called "The Hahvahd Tour."

Also, if you'd like to tour the campus on your own, the "Harvard Tour" app is available on both iOS and Android. Free wifi is available throughout the university.

title: Very interesting
text: It was a very interesting visit because we were led by a Harvard university student. Her experience gave us a different view of the city and we would like out daughter to study there.

title: visit
text: Harvard University does not need any review but so to say as a tourist one can learn the history of this institution and what great personalities made history after graduating from here and some of the known ones who chose to just drop out and make big names for themselves. The student housing areas were still alive during this time when everyone is on a vacation. How the old buildings are considered beautiful and the new ones ugly 😊. The memorial hall building only for freshman was a landmark , I wish we could have experienced the insides ! The church which was now under renovation dates back years and the huge literary which runs 54 miles of books was only for students but not the guests . You will learn a lot about these once u visit. The residences of Kennedys and Mark Zuckerberg to begin with .

title: Green pastures of Harvard University
text: I remember Harvard in the 60s and 70s with lots of free concerts and interesting people to talk with.

title: Buy a Guide Book and Read Before your begin Walking
text:
The original Harvard Yard and Harvard College is now surrounded by other Harvard esteemed colleges. Some buildings the public can gain access to (although signage lists them as restricted). The interesting parts of Harvard are certainly easy to find, there is so much more to Harvard than the central core of the university. I strongly urge visitors to travel the less trodden paths and view some of the off the beaten path buildings, alleys, yards, and buildings. Many of these offer extraordinary views of art and architecture that is steeped in history. Please, avoid the canned tours and take a few minutes to sit on the lawn and take in the feel of the true Harvard. It is a living institution that happens to be part museum and very much a part of history. 
Is it a good rainy day activity? Yes, if you only have one day. It is a part of Boston that can not be missed. Bring an umbrella if you need to.

title: Must see
text: If you are visiting Boston, you have to visit the most prestigious university of the USA. Don't be fooled by those shops selling tickets for 12$, every hour, students give free tours around the campus and tell you about its history. Informative and pleasant visit, and easy to get there by metro from Boston. Great!

title: Want to have a little fun with a friend or family member?
text:
We were in Boston for a week or so, and headed over to Cambridge where we walked around Harvard's grounds - beautiful.

There are gates all around the campus - it appears they're dedicated by different classes, as their year is included in the wrought iron work.

At any rate, walking through the gate gave a sense of entering.  So I called my father (who thinks I cheated myself by deciding to stay home and raise kids) and said "Hey, Dad!  I wanted you to be the first to know, I just entered Harvard!"  Poor guy.  He was so proud in that moment, and so disappointed the next, when I explained that I wouldn't be there more than an hour.

I'm sure that's not funny to everyone, but I thought I'd share for the rest of you...

title: Worth seeing
text: Definitely a historic place worth a stroll. Lovely buildings and courtyards, although I agree with other reviewers that it's probably best in fall rather than the sweltering day we visited!

title: Visit a University
text: We paid a visit to Harvard University. I had heard so much about the University, and happily it fulfilled my expectations. The University is such a huge campus, and with such beautiful and old buildings. It was a lifetime experience.

title: Fantastic natural history and archaeological museums
text: I feel that this music was on par with anything I've seen in the Smithsonian. Fantastic museums, incredible fossil displays and an extensive Gem and Mineral display. I was lucky enough to see the glass models of plants and flowers while I was there.

title: Harvard university tour
text: I took a tour of Harvard University - 'Free tour by foot'. the tour was given by Harvard students. They explained the Harvard culture quite well, showed where the popular graduates from Harvard lived. They also recommended restaurants in the Harvard Square area. I would highly recommend this tour to someone visiting Boston for a vacation.

title: Tour was awesome and hilarious
text: Tour was worth doing. We had Joe as our tour guide and he was awesome! He knew his history on Harvard and was very hilarious and made the tour fun! Had a great time at Harvard. Beautiful campus!

title: Don't Expect Too Much
text: My family and I were visiting Boston so we decided to take a short trip to Harvard University. Since it was raining, we just drove around. It wasn't that exciting, because there was no official Harvard entrance gate or anything similar to that. Overall, I would still reccomend visiting Harvard, but I wouldn't expect to be thrilled.

title: Loved the student led guided tour!!
text:
We wanted to take a free guided tour but we never found the information office so we decided to pay and took a student led guided tour (12$ per person/ buy tickets at Harvard square) which lasted one hour. The tours seem to start at 10am and run every 30min. We took the 10am tour and it was not too crowded which enhanced the experience. The grounds are filled with tourists - you can wonder where all the students are!!
The tour was let by Branson and it was a very enjoyable experience. He was clear in his explanations and provided a lot of funny insights. We walked through the different university buildings (outside only) and learnt a lot about the campus history. Highly recommended. We had a great time!!

title: Harcard campus: slightly disappointing
text: The tour we took of the campus was interesting, but I was expecting the campus to be prettier. I was surprised that none of the buildings match each other. My own beloved Ohio University campus is so much prettier. But overall a nice visit.

title: A university with a history
text: We have learned a lot more about this prestigious University. We went there as we visited family in Boston, and my husband spend a summer there studying. So it was a remembrance for him and maybe the future for our kids. We wanted them to see it and we have been really impressed. Can you imagine that over 68000 students are applying and only 4000 are studying there. The campus is amazing, we booked a tour that Harvard students organizes so you get to know the place better and really wish you were there to study too. Sorry we could not visit the library one of the largest in the US.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Walked around Harvard and the campus was beautiful and really neat to see. They have beautiful buildings and statues. Definitely worth exploring the campus!

title: College visit
text: Well this bored my 13 year old tears...the senior and junior were ok. As college tours go, it was pretty par for the course. What I left with, out of the info session was, is that if you can make in...good grades, enticing essay...etc....Harvard is attainable for everyone...that was promising and felt good. The student run tour, had a few historical tidbits which I found interesting, and otherwise it was standard college tour fare! I was surprised to learn that Harvard was a liberal arts college...

title: Stunning!
text: What to say about this magnificent place? Cambridge and Harvard University are truly a gem! The atmosphere is fantastic; you can spend all day long walking around the campus and the adjacent streets and dorms. The different architectural's styles are engaging; the solitude of the campus is a real inspiration, you can stay as long as you want and enjoy the silence. I truly recommend Harvard and Cambridge!

title: A Definitely must visit
text: A Definitely must visit. Very impressive. Nice big, clean university. Did the student tours. The students are very impressive. Definitely was my highlight when we visited Boston.

title: Simply Awesome
text: We finally got the chance to visit this great institution. My daughter said when she was 5 that she wanted to go to Harvard to study meteorology. She's 10 now and I hope she fulfills her dream. We were able to sit on the law just as they did in the movie Legally Blonde. SO much history at this school. It is worth the trip.

title: The history make it worthwhile.
text:
We visited on he advise of our daughter who had visited a year ago. Plus trip advisor gives Harvard a good rating. It wasn't as wow as we were expecting but the tour guide was excellent and the history of the place, the library story and the statue info made for a very interesting hour. 
The buildings were beautiful and the grounds well care for. You wouldn't visit Cambridge without taking the tour.

title: Good but didn't quite meet expectations
text:
I visited the campus and took a 2hr walking tour. It was easy to get to. Take the red line train about 4 stops from downtown. It took about 10-15 mins and the train arrives just under Harvard Square.

As a tourist attraction it didn't meet my expectations but i still enjoyed it. Having been to oxford and cambridge i maybe unrealistically expected something as grand and picturesque, but harvard isnt quite that. Its very functional, most buildings are off limits and the garden areas are just grass. There is a range of shops and cafes around the Harvard Square.

I would recommend visiting but would suggest taking a tour once you get there.

title: Must see, but don't need to spend the day there.
text: Wasn't my favorite stop, but I'm sure I'd feel differently if we took an guided tour and heard stories and history.  Only had an hour to walk around, and that was enough for me.  Lots of foot traffic and tourist and the place shows it... yikes!

title: Interesting
text: Was good to go and have a look around this famous campus. Plenty of sights and the natural history museum was interesting. The nearby shops are pretty good too so it's worth making your way out to Hahhhvard.

title: Harvard Campus Tour
text:
Took the campus tour (which was led by the students, I forgot the name but I think there's only one. The stall is on the island in Harvard Square) with my friends and we had an excellent experience. 

The tour guide was Justin, he was funny and awesome!! The way he narrated the whole tour was on point, he walked and waited for most of the group (there's always going to be few people who would take their time and took pictures; me, myself, was one of them). His voice was loud and clear. If you want to do the tour, ask for Justin. You won't regret it. He told many interesting stories about the campus. I'm not gonna say it here, you need to take the tour yourself to hear it.

At the end of

title: Do the Havaad Tour
text: So much fun and Melissa, our guide, was awesome!  I loved her and her stories and personality.  I just wish that we could have seen inside some of the buildings, especially the library.

title: Beautiful
text:
What a beautiful campus. It seems never ending. Old buildings and the museum of natural history is right there ( around the corner from Harvard law school ) there were several food trucks in the square and people playing a giant chess board. 
We walked around in awe for about an hour and saw there were several Tours. We learned the tours were free and you can join up any time ( just remember to tip
Your guide ) :) 
Don't miss Harvard square with the boutiques and the famous Harvard book store.

title: Harvard
text: Harvard - anyone here OUGHT to study; even research is study.  And it's costly UNLESS the brilliant in-demand student gets 'a free ride' from the University

title: Expectations
text: We came to check out the campus and man I was really disappointed by the grounds.  So ugly, good luck finding any flowers or anything pretty to look at.  The grass was not even well kept.  You would think they could spend a little money on landscaping.  There were tourist everywhere, we did fine without joining a tour.  If you sit outside the steps of Memorial church you will hear several tours stop by and give the run down.  Don't expect to enter many of the buildings, as most are for students, which is expected. The most interesting thing I saw was a truck full of bread.

title: Take A Tour
text: We took a one hour free tour of Harvard that took us through Harvard Yard. The tour provides interesting facts and historical information, and allows you to go into some of Harvard's many beautiful buildings. To take the free tour, go to the Richard and Susan F Smith Campus Center located at Mount Auburn and Dunster St.

title: Busy place.
text: This was one of the busiest places we visited in the Boston area.  Lots of future student hopefuls and even more hopeful parents.  The campus has a lot of history and many lovely buildings.  It is worth the trip, even for a quick 1/2 hour walk through. You can't go into any buildings as a regular tourist.  Take note of the Henry Moore sculpture.

title: Tour
text: I first spent some time walking the area but then decided to go with a tour. The latter added a lot of context, mixed with jokes around a sinking Titanic whenever the story allowed it. The tour is not a must, but a quick and cheap way to gather a lot of facts related to the university.

title: Great cruise!
text: https://www.facebook.com/buzzfeedtasty/videos/1774789402773701/E did combo trip with Gray line hop off and on and really enjoyed cruise. We had Irish guide and ai can't recall his name but funny, interesting and just really enjoyed!

title: Great tour
text:
We had Gianna, she was awesome. She was very energetic and animated. Great tour. Highly recommend this tour
She made the tour funny and interesting !

title: Go with a tour guide
text: Harvard is a must do if you are in the Boston area. But go visit with a tour guide. They'll tell you so much more. Buildings don't have the sense of Agra and history that you get if you see Oxford. But the tour guide can tell you so much about the area. Widener hall in particular was great.

title: Lovely buildings
text: Harvard Yard is beautiful. The student led tours looked very popular and entertaining. Nice for a stroll through in the summer sunshine

title: Excellent free tour at Harvard
text: Wow! Our tour guide made our experience at Harvard one of the most memorable guided tours during our 2 weeks stay in the US. The walk through the yard, the funny stories and the amount of history she shared with us made us all feel smarter and wished we had had the opportunity to attend Harvard! If you are in Boston this is a must!!

title: Don't miss!
text: The museums - in particular, natural history - are spectacular. The glass flowers and animals are fascinating for all ages.

title: Such beautiful buildings
text:
We literally only walked past, but such beautiful buildings and surrounding scenery. 

Oh and we stopped off for coffee on campus. I have no idea what the name of the place was but the coffee was great

title: Awesome
text: Went the Harvard Museum of Natural History what a place well worth checking it out .The place had every animal it seemed on this plant and the meteor collection was amazing.

title: Harvard University / Visiting the World's leading university is a must when visiting Boston
text: Harvard University was founded in 1632 and is the oldest center of learning in the World . It is rated the best university in the world ahead of Yale , Oxford and Cambridge . It is located on both sides of the Charles River and in a beautiful setting and same for the buildings housing 11 faculties , 21.000 students and 2.100 professors . The endowment fund is by far the biggest in the world with USD 37 billion . Students from 201 countries has attended Harvard . The Harvard Square is a great place for meeting up or having a meal while students are passing by . It is really a wonderful university and well worth a visit .

title: Harvard Yard - Always Busy
text: During the past 6 summers I've had the opportunity make my way through Harvard Yard on my way to and from class. I'm always struck by just how early the tours get going, and how many people are on campus.  Early mornings are my favorite, as it's quiet, shady and very few folks are around. The chairs around the Yard are usually empty in the mornings. By afternoon, it is tricky to navigate my way back through as I weave between tours in various languages and every chair is usually taken. The nearby food trucks make this a great stop for lunch, too.

title: Always wanted to see Harvard
text: A very historic school. My wife and I went on a Sunday evening to check out university and its community. It was very busy with other tourists. Was not that exciting, but something to do.

title: A university with its tradition !
text: We visited this university as part of the free walking tour at Cambridge. The college campus is awesome, full of history from renowned politicians to scientist, the old yard is amazing you have to see the memorial church, memorial hall and the library. Touring this university is like travel back in time. Please do visit some of the free exhibits in the library. I was convinced that this US university is indeed an American Treasure and icon.

title: Wonderful!
text:
A wonderful, inspiring, amazing place to visit and to study.
We made a walking tour and felt to inspires to study and leave there.

title: Harvard Tour
text: Excellent tour of the Campus by our Tour Guide Jake, very informative and although the jokes were a bit lame we did have a good laugh. Good value for the money tour and would recommend it as part of any Boston itinerary.

title: Interesting visit of a university with a forgotten past
text: There is so much interesting history to this ivy league school. Unfortunately it's been long forgotten.

title: Herritage of note
text: Visited in March 2015. What a nice experience. The old buildings is a pretty site. The old gate where first years enter. All the old customs. And to think all of this started in 1634. Buildings are well maintained.  A pleasant visit.

title: Entertaining and Informative Tour
text: Really enjoyed our one hour tour round Harvard. The buildings take on a new life when you know why they were built , who lived in them and the stories that make up Harvard's history over the last 300+ years. Our guide ( Zach - 2nd year Psychology)  was informative entertaining and encouraged us to ask any questions on student life. did a neat backwards walk throughout the tour as well to keep facing us! $10 per person. Easy to walk.

title: Free tours by foot
text: Excellent! Even though it was a very warm day, our guide, David P., made the journey very cool and as they say: once in Harvard you be come wiser

title: Prospective students tour and information session is great
text: Our daughter is considering attending Harvard so we came for the information session and tour.  Both were very well done and worth your time if you have a prospective student.

title: Beautiful campus...historic and modern buildings
text:
In summer, you can sit on the quad in lots of lawn chairs scattered around. Tons of people - most of them tourists - hanging out. LOADS of parents with high school-age children, all of them to marinate in the atmosphere - and hope that somehow a visit pays off come admission time.

Harvard Square is literally outside the gates. It's a little more buffed and polished over the last 25 years, fewer local shops, more chains trying to look ye-old shoppe or hipster modern.

The University has several outstanding museums. Visit their websites to see admission times and rates. Massachusetts residents get into the Harvard Museum free on Saturday mornings.

title: Beautiful Campus with a great small town
text: Stopped in to get the Harvard experience. The campus is beautiful and the people were charming. We did not do to the guided tour but it is very easy to find your way around campus. The town surrounding the campus has so many great shops and eats. Harvard Square had everything anyone would ever need.

title: Lovely grounds
text: We wanted to see Cambridge and Harvard and wandered around the grounds one morning for about an hour. The grounds and buildings are lovely (not quite as nice as Yale) and really well kept.

title: Good not great
text: I expected more from our visit to Harvard and although the University has some beauty it was simple without the "Wow" effect.  Someone said it is one of the only Universities that is also a tourist attraction.  It was crowded with too many people walking around, even large tour busses.  They would benefit from limited access for their personal interest tours and better grounds upkeep.

title: Great tour and tour guide
text: Our tour guide from Alaska (I say her name was Anna, but my GF says it was Katherine) gave us a complete and very informative tour around campus and introduce ourselves to the Harvard culture. She was very nice and willing to answer all our questions in spite of the amount of people of our huge group. Totally recommended!!!!

title: Harvard Tour by students
text: Easy to access by train. Our guide, Eric, had just finished his first year at Harvard and gave a great tour of the area. He shared lots of info about the history of Harvard and being a student there. It is worth taking this tour.

title: Do the official tour given by the students
text: It's worth touring one of the world's best universities with a current student of the university. They may not have all the facts and colourful stories, but they give the tour real meaning and context. Well worthwhile and inspiring for would be students.

title: Beautiful, Historic Campus
text: We did the Harvard Tour for $10 per person. It was led by a Harvard student and was very informative. You can purchase tickets in Harvard Square. What a beautiful campus with so much history and stories!!

title: DIY walking tour in Cambridge
text:
I stayed at Boston Park Plaza near Public Garden, and form there I walked over to Harvard University. The thing I enjoy most when visiting a new place is just walking around to really see and experience the area. From my hotel to Harvard, it was a   an-hour-and-12-minute walk, according to Google Maps. If you are an urban hiker and are OK walking this kind of distance like me, read on!

From Public Garden, there are many streets running parallel to one another. I walked on all of them and the Esplanade toward Harvard Bridge. They are all charming. Newbury offers high-end shopping and the view of the Charles River walking along the Esplanade is wonderful. 

After crossing Harvard Bridge, you see MIT. I visited on the 4th of July, so unfortunately everything was closed. Otherwise, I would have been interested in visiting MIT Museum. After seeing MIT, stay on Massachusetts Avenue no matter what Google Maps says. I typed in Harvard University as my destination, and really got lost. So try some other destination or just stay on Massachusetts till you see Harvard. 

The area surrounding the University is very charming, with lots of eateries and shops. The red brick campus is, of course, worth a visit. Now, here's one of the highlights of my walking tour:

Whenever I plan a walking tour like this,  especially on Sunday or major holidays, I really worry about whether or not there are any toilets along the way. ( Harvard and MIT are universities, not amusement parks, people! ). I did some search and found a very recent article saying "the very first public bathroom in the Harvard area made a "grand opening" in February, 2016!  The article sounded like the appropriateness of putting a public loo right in front of Harvard was controversial for many reasons. I was so curious I went to find it, and to see if it's really there.

The bathroom was very clean and  spacious, and very good-looking. Only one stall. For those who go to a bathroom twice a day, it might be laughable for me to write this much about one. But for others, it is an important issue. If I hadn't stumbled on the article about this new addition to the area, I probably would have visited Aquarium on the 4th. 

So, to whomever came up to this idea and made it happen, thank you very much. I really enjoyed visiting Cambridge on Independence Day, 2016.

title: OK, So - It's Harvard
text: Harvard's not nearly as architecturally significant as the university its namesake attended [Cambridge University, England, as a student at Emmanuel College]. All the same, it's a nice campus for a walk about [ particularly during the peak of the autumn leaf's color splendor.

title: Nice to visit
text:
We were here on a Saturday, along with half of Boston, it seemed.

It was nice to wonder around the buildings.  There was plenty of shade from the old trees, so it was nice and cool.

Most of the university buildings are closed to the public.

title: A great university!
text: Walking through Harvard Yard is a treat. Visit the Harvard art museums. The Harvard Business School campus across the Charles River is a delightful walk across the Weeks Footbridge.

title: An exciting experience
text:
Being in the campus that taught 10 presidents it's pretty awesome. Campus is beautiful full of trees and incredible buildings.
I took my children in a tour there and they loved it!

title: Exspected more
text: Went to the musuems and walked on campus. For a place that has been around for over 350 years the museums were pretty lame. The campus was nice but no nicer then lots of others i have been on.

title: Harvard Campus was amazing to experience. Highly recommendable
text: I also would like to give a special thanks to Zayan Faiyad for a great guided tour around campus; excellent in giving a personal touch and some exiting stories from her own experiences.

title: Neat place
text: It was pretty cool to see one of the worlds best schools the campus is really cool to see and the student guides were informative.

title: Oxana was great! If you like to hear about Harvard atmosphere- this tour is the place.
text: Oxana was great! If you like to hear about Harvard atmosphere- this tour is the place. Worth 10$. The tour is leaving every 30 minutes from Harvard square.

title: Interesting & Informative
text: Good tour for $10. Melissa was out tour guide and she was knowledgeable, friendly and enthusiastic. Only downside they show you the building me but you can't go in

title: Beautiful canpus
text: I am attending an institute sponsored by Harvard Graduate School of Education. We took a tour of the beautiful campus. As you walk around campus, excellence is in the air.

title: Great tour by current student .....
text: We tried to find the Harvard Information Centre to book a free tour by existing student but we could not find it instead we tagged along with a tour already proceeding.  Had a great time, guide was friendly, funny and informative.  We learned a lot, we recommend a tour.  Buildings and history fantastic.

title: Fun way to see the campus
text: We took the tour last week and really enjoyed it.  The tour only lasted about an hour so you don't see a lot of the campus.  However, it was fun to hear the stories and get a little history lesson.  The tour only costs $10 per person and we felt it was worth it.

title: Campus Tour a Must
text: We took the free one-hour tour led by a Harvard student, and it was outstanding. He had a great personality and told some great stories about the university, some real and some folklore. It was a nice way to see the campus, and the best part about it was the price! It even came with a 15% off coupon at the Harvard store, so we got a nice t-shirt to take home.

title: Inspiring visit to world's most prestigious university
text: My 11 year-old did a report for school on FDR.  In her research, she learned that he attended Harvard and has been obsessed with the prospect of visiting this university ever since.  We took a "tour" offered by a free app available for our Iphone and even got to eavesdrop on a tour being offered by a Harvard student.  She told us the story of the library's benefactor, a grieving mother who lost her son on the Titanic.  We hung out in Harvard Yard and strolled through Harvard Square.  All in all, a great visit.

title: No stuffed shirts here!
text:
We were delighted with our Hahvahd tour.   The junior student guide was well trained, informative, and delightful.  And, she is clearly smart and committed to doing great things in life.  

Overview of the history of Harvard, its buildings, and culture.   As I hoped, our 15 yo grandson got a glimpse of what could be in his future.    The discussion of how the university supports its students and conducts campus life was very enlightening.  

We were impressed by the number of student run enterprises on campus; not only giving pay to students but work experience and a lot of business management experience as well.    

We got this tour as an add on to the duck boat tour, but I strongly recommend it even if you have to buy a separate ticket.    

Tour guides are students, we were prepared to make a meaningful tip for at the end of the tour.   That is an important thing for all of us to do.

title: Work visit
text: What a great place to visit let alone go to school.  Plenty to see and do.  Lots of history.  Very open minded campus.  Obtw, it is an open campus so anyone and visit.

title: Beautiful Anytime of Year
text: Of course you should visit Harvard University. It's the country's oldest--in fact it's older than its country--and one of the most famous and prestigious universities in the world. It also happens to be gorgeous. A stroll through Harvard Yard is lovely in every season, though I do recommend summer or fall, and fall more than summer. It's also a good idea to take the tour. As a local, I generally just eat and drink at Harvard Square and use the spot in transit to and from various places. I've never taken the tour, but many of my ESL students have and have loved it. Harvard and Cambridge are essential parts of a trip to Boston though, so don't think about skipping them. You'd be missing out.

title: Great campus
text: Harvard University has a beautiful campus. It was very clean. The students and faculty all seemed very friendly. Overall, it is a great school!

title: University tour by a student
text:
Travelled to Harvard via subway from downtown Boston.  Very quick and easy.
It is free to walk around the university
Tour cost $10 each, tickets from newsstand near to subway exit.  Your guide is a Harvard student.  This is a far better way of understanding Harvard than just looking at some old buildings.
Tour last just over an hour.
Our guide was Jake.  An expert at walking backwards.
We had a fantastic time.
Jake was knowledgable, friendly and interactive with our group of approx 10 people.
We learnt a lot about the university, and it's history, without even realising we were being taught.
We had a laugh, enjoyed every minute, Jake made it fun.
The time went so quickly.
I will unreservedly recommend this tour to anyone.

title: Beautiful architecture, green campus
text: One cannot complete a Boston/Cambridge tour without visiting one of the most presitgious universities in the world. The architecture of the buildings here is truly world class, and it is a very inspiring sight. We covered most of the buildings (without going into a lot of details) in about 3-4 hours.

title: Harvard the golden gate of knowledge
text: I went to Harvard with my son who pursuing Phd at Harvard.The campus is very nice and attractive to the travellers too.

title: Student Tours on Campus
text: Great way to learn some history of the university and it's buildings, statues and student culture. Jacob was our tour guide, an enthusiastic and insightful senior who shared personal stories of his experience while studying at Harvard. The tour was a great way to see the prime spots within Harvard and get a sense of what it's like to be a student.

title: Harvard university tour
text: A great way to gt a quick view of the campus and also get a view of capus life. Good for kids to get to see what to expect.

title: Awe-inspiring
text: The campus is huge, and if you're interested in touring the campus on your own it requires a really early morning wake up call. It's a beautiful campus and my 10 year old was ready to hit the ground running after an hour.

title: Typical Campus
text: Clean, green area around a typical historic university. The museums on campus are well worth the visit.

title: Great free tour around campus
text:
The Visitor Center offers a free tour around campus, conducted by Harvard students. It´s pretty amazing to hear part of the stories of such a traditional institution.
I recommend checking the schedule of the tour previously on the Visitor Center website.

title: Harvard Law School
text:
Lewis International Law Center, Harvard Law School is one of the best places for international law education. 

The Center is just a 7 minutes walk from the Red-Line Harvard Station.

title: History lies here...
text: A must see...one of the great names in the academic field...a lot of history is here...unique place in the world...

title: Harvard is Harvard
text: Plenty of young students, some families. Nothing special visually, just a large yard surrounding by buildings. But I guess, I just found nice to visit the campus of one of the most prestigious Universities!

title: Fun Day to browse
text: We had wanted to see the Harvard Campus area. It was very interesting. We visited a gift store and smoothie place. The atmosphere was very cultural due to the diversity of the people on the streets. There were a number of different eating places. The buildings were distinguished looking. It was easy to walk to a lot of places.

title: Ivy League beautiful campus
text: Historic buildings dot a lovely green campus. In the south we have many beautiful universities however the heat will prevent your lingering on the grass. while I Harvard for a business conference I observed students lounging on the grass commons.

title: History of US Elite
text: This place was our final destination during our 3 day trip to Boston and we wanted to visit here because we wanted to show our kids one of the best schools in the United States. We were hoping that this visit will influence our 10 and 7 year old kids. Campus is large, beautiful and full of energy and kids loved this experience. We also visited the museum and I just felt so much of the national support for these students who will lead the nation one day. Definitely, this is the place people should go to study if they are qualified to challenge themselves to be a leader one day.

title: Great Free Family Outing
text:
There are a variety of gates leading in from all sides of Harvard Yard; be sure to look up to read what may be carved above the gate you choose.  The campus is beautiful with mature trees and lots of shaded lawn that the kids can run across.  The kids may also enjoy climbing the many steps to Widener Library - great photo.  Have them look up Widener Library and who Harry Widener was and why all Harvard students must pass a swimming test.
Memorial Church is directly across from the library.  You may be able to respectfully enter and attend a service there and read the wall to your right where those from Harvard who died in WWII are listed.  Note the 3 Roosevelts.  Why are they on the wall?  Should poor Kermit be there?  Talk about FDR's role in this war.
Find the statue of 3 lies.  Rub it's toe - it's just what you do.  Have the kids tell you the 3 lies.
Find the site of the building occupied by General Washington and his staff during the Revolutionary War...your kids will be able to look this up...they basically took over Harvard, eh kids?  There is a plaque describing the fort built as directed by Gen. Washington at 101 Waverly Street in Cambridge; it's embankments are the only remaining Revolutionary War bits in Cambridge.  Where is this in relation to the Charles River and why did the General have it constructed there, kids?
Parents, explain why the Harvard Science Center was referred to as the Polaroid Building.  Point out the ways in which it really looks like a Polaroid camera (consult your own parents, as necessary).  The kids can look up who funded it.  Why aren't Polaroid cameras and film made anymore?  They were fun.  As fun as SnapChat?  Discuss.
The Harvard Natural History Museum is as amazing as walking around the Yard and worth the cost.  Your kids can't run through it as they can outside but they will be entertained well beyond what they'll expect.  Yes, kids, the glass flowers are glass...you could look it up.

title: I'm probably biased
text:
As a former student I'm probably biased...but really do you need me or anyone else to sell you on seeing one of the greatest schools on the planet?

You can get tours, but you don't really need to. Harvard has tons of free apps you can download and it geo locates to tell you what building you're at and the history of it.

It's truly one of the most beautiful campus' you could ever imagine! It's got incredible architecture and beautiful Ivy everywhere! 

If you aren't a student you're not going to get into the buildings either way, tour or no tour but just walking around the campus is breathtaking! 

If you're in the area you're truly missing out if you don't take the time to go see this marvelous piece of history!!!!!

title: Springtime!
text: The campus is lovely and unexpected.  The beautiful buildings are set off by the "city" all around them.

title: Beautiful campus in a lovely setting
text: After seeing some of Cambridge on the trolley trip I was so surprised  to see how charming the town next to the campus was. The campus is beautiful and the history feels palatable. The green space is lovely and the architecture is beautiful. We didn't have time for a tour but next time we would book it. The  neighborhood surrounding the Harvard Yard is full of shops, restaurants,bars and more. Wonderful selection of souvenirs, lots of choices to grab a bite, great section just to stroll. Great way to spend a couple of hours while in Boston!

title: Not much to see
text: There wasn't anything special about the university. Unless you're willing to take a tour to go through the buildings, it's not worth the visit.

title: Great tour
text: Very much enjoyed the student led tour. Lots of interesting info.  Good insights.  Now my grandson can say he "went" to Harvard.  Recommended restaurant nearby: Clover.

title: You can say you went to Harvard!
text: Harvard is very similar to what you would expect, lots of rich guys walking around, beautiful architecture and famous landmarks. It is definitely worth taking a walk with the rest of the tourist around Harvard Square and some of the buildings that are open to the public. If for nothing else, that to say that you ve done it.

title: Ok
text: I ended up wandering around, I wouldn't say I was amazed, however I didn't have any way of navigating around. So perhaps the lack of enthusiasm of experience was down to me.

title: It is a beautiful campus
text:
This campus is huge, and beautiful. I have mainly visited the Harvard Yard and some buildings around. The yard is really pretty on the summer, when everything is green and the tress are at is best.
There is something about brick buildings that I find so pretty so for me is what makes this place so pretty, is surrounded of brick and nice old constructions, it makes me wish I was smarter (and with tons of money) so I could study in a place like.

title: A beautiful campus
text: Having spent many years of my life at university, I couldn't come to Boston and not walk around the main campus. Spending time in other sections of the university, isn't the same as visiting the statue and enjoying the scale of the library (outside only for tourists) and having a walk around this great university full of history. Take the time to read the plaques and you get a sense of all that has happened on these grounds.

title: Very Beautiful Campus
text:
Came here and walked around this beautiful campus while on a trip to Boston. There are so many beautiful tree lined areas and interesting buildings. 

We have vowed to come back here in the fall to really experience the campus fully

title: Trip down memory lanes
text: Lot of changes in the campus area however some things remain constant. The Harvard Co-op book store, the cafes, new and old  taking pictures etc.

title: Beautiful Historic Campus
text: Walking around Harvard campus is like walking in history.  Beautiful historic buildings, arches with quotes, statues, and of course lots of students. If you are lucky enough to know a student who is willing to take you into the Widener Library as their guest make sure to do it. The Widener Library was built as a memorial to Harry Widener who died on the Titanic.

title: a great campus to walk on
text: i love harvard.  i love the old buildings and the atmosphere.  the main library with the stairs to great to sit and hang out.  i came with a school group but i know that my own kids want to come and visit.    it has so much history and there were/are so many great minds that have attended here.

title: Nice just to wander around and soak up the academic atmosphere
text: Harvard has plenty of attractive and interesting buildings which are worthy of a wander through.  Sanders theatre/ Annenberg Hall are shining examples of wooden roof construction and beautiful carving.

title: Grad weekend
text: It was nice to see lots of families around the quad towards the end of graduation week.  Of course there are plenty of old, beautifully academic buildings, all with endowments to keep them looking appropriately old.  Others will comment on Harvard itself... I just liked how modern universities haven't really deviated from this initial layout.

title: Worth the time
text: It's a nice campus. Not amazing but worth visiting if you have the time, because it is Harvard after all.

title: Worth a visit.
text:
We visited the campus and the area around it and it was a few hours well worth it.
It was after the graduation ceremonies and the university was now closed so ypu could walk around the grounds without too many people.
It's free to visit but keep in mind that you can not enter buildings etc.
It's only 15-20 minutes from downtown Boston and you could go by subway but even a taxi ride across the river is about 20 dollars each way and that way you could see a bit of Cambridge 
Worth a couple of hours visit.

title: Great Tour of Harvard campus!
text: My cousins and I did the Cambridge & Harvard Tour organized by Free Tours By Foot. It was an amazing experience! The tour guide, David P, was very knowledgable and easy to get along with. He gave us in-depth history and background behind all the major spots. It's unbelievable that the tour is FREE! I whole-heartedly recommend this tour and others organized by them. I have enjoyed four tours organized by them in two different cities and have never been disappointed.

title: Beautiful, Best Univeristy!
text: I visited Harvard as a part of my college visit. It is at the very end of the tour and it. Was raining. Still the excitement within me arose. The tour guide was very friendly, and the campus is absolutely stunning. She talks able it her experiences in Harvard, and despite raining, we saw so many scholars doing their work busily under the roof, not wanting to be disturbed. The campus is magnificent, covered in a low key red, with raining it was added with a partial degree of elegance. After the visit, I feel like I actually fall in love with Harvard, wanting to study there, and wanting to belong there.

title: Become part of history - Harvard Commencement Exercises
text:
My daughter is now a graduate of this University. It is an experience that cannot be matched. My daughter is sad a bit to leave her friends (as a senior - an awesome view from her room). 
380 years of academic history lay within this institution. I took a bit in but not enough. There are museums galore and the arts, and public lectures. 
Take your family, find something that appeals to each. It's all there.
Sports, sailing, science, music, plays, performances of various types.

title: Great historic
text: If you are visiting Boston take the Red line a few stops north to Harvard and spend an afternoon strolling through the green yards of this great university. When you're done head down to the river and take in the sights of the river.

title: Weekend getaway
text: Good for an afternoon stroll. Walking around the campus, bring a bed sheet and lye down on the green grass and just chill for the afternoon.

title: 60th Reunion
text: Great visit.  30,000 attendees making the yard a really crowded space.  The museums continue to be outstanding and the Glass Flower exhibit is back after a refurbishing.  Really outstanding.  The college grounds are well-maintained and Memorial Church is an outstanding venue.  Great organ and a massive bell in the bell tower,

title: Gorgeous campus
text:
Got a tour from two recent alums.  Lovely campus with relaxed feeling, although it was after classes ended and graduation chairs/tents were being set up.

Very historic, yet it didn't have an uptight pretentiousness that I was expecting.  Pleasant experience overall.

title: Wow, very impressive.
text: The building were magnificent. Just walking around the campus had such an intellectual feel to eat. We laughed that we seemed smarter when we left the campus.

title: Most prestigious
text: Established in1636, Harvard is a private research institute which is the U.S.  oldest institution of higher learning is situated in Cambridge not very far from Charles river. It is named after its first benefactor John Harvard and in terms of prestige, influence , culture and excellence it is the best in the world. It was the founding member of Association of American Universities in1900. It's  dozen campuses are spread out in  the Boston metropolitan area. It's almost 40 billion dollar  financial endowment is the largest in the world enabling it  to offer good aid packages. It operates see verbal museums and large library.

title: Lovely atmosphere
text: We just stopped by to eat our lunch on the stairs of the main building and got to listen to a very enthusiastic young guide who took her group there. The whole place is extremely well maintained and it's great to stop at and get some rest when you get tired of walking.

title: Nothing to do
text: It's nice to walk around this place and get a bit of a feel for it. Buy a sweater and T-shirt and stuff. The only thing i didn't like was the fact that you can not go in to any building so besides walking around there isn't much else to do.

title: great place - wish I went to school there!
text: really lovely area with pretty buildings, lots of energy, cool shops and eateries.  wish I had gone to school here!

title: The grounds are worth a visit
text: In the spring you may find a guide at the exit of the T, and a map of the grounds. In the winter, maybe a map from the guidebook. Take note of the fun stories! The so called Harvard statue, who was the model? Do the students pea on it at night time, or is it a joke? The museums and the Coop are also worth a visit.

title: Great ancient and historical building with many nice people around
text: I finally visit HARVARD !!! Great ancient building. I can feel so much dream, spirit, pray and effort live and nurture this campus

title: Touring History
text: We all decided to tour one of the most prestigious universities in the United States. Harvard is so beautiful. The library is so majestic and you need your picture taken with the statue of the founder John Harvard. Everyone should have Harvard on your list of sites to see in the Boston area.

title: Buildings are nice...grounds not so much
text:
The buildings were nice.  But the grounds were a let down.  No flowers, bushes, flowering bushes...you get the idea.  The grass wasn't lush...just thin blades and all of the grass was roped off.  I'm not sure what I was expecting but I figured the grounds would be beautiful and in full spring color.
Wander around for a little bit if you'd like...but I think you would probably enjoy it just as much from one of the hop on hop off trolley tours.

title: Why would you NOT visit?
text:
It's Harvard. If you're in Boston, go visit the campus. DUH. 

My personal guide is a research assistant on campus, and a very good guide indeed. We visited the big library (Widener?) - be sure and check out the room holding this guy's original book collection, including a Gutenberg Bible. 

The history and architecture of this campus is insane. Find a local or someone who works there to give you the tour to be sure you learn all the cool stuff. 

Definitely visit Memorial Hall. Stunning building, inside and out.

title: It's Harvard
text: You gotta check it out there's only one! Architecture alone makes it worth the visit. Time stood still around here. It's pretty cool to think of everyone from JFK to President's Obama and Bush and so many more went there!

title: Not that great
text: I've been to lots of campuses around this country and this is my first time at this storied place.  It was a bit of a let down.  You can't go in a bunch of the buildings.  The place is a bit run down and there is no longer any ivy.  Seriously?  Go to USNA and see a beautiful campus well-kept and full of courteous students.  Oops - a little giveaway there....

title: Remarkable Harvard
text: A tree lined, lovely oasis in the center of the very desirable Cambridge, Mass. Harvard is historic and welcoming with beautiful, predominantly brick, buildings. The library is grand and expansive and the students and employees are incredibly helpful, friendly and warm. In addition to ranking "the best university in the world," Harvard offers dance and theatrical performances open to the public. These performances rival Broadways best! Harvard Yard is a lovely place to sit and people watch and observe the future leaders of the world.

title: Do the walking tour
text: We took the "Hahvard Walking Tour" led by a student - it was excellent! It included history, an informative walk around the campus. The tour lasts about 80 minutes. We learnt a lot and enjoyed the tour. Recommended.

title: Not what I expected
text: To be honest I thought the place looked a bit run down. The grass lawns suffer from the foot traffic and makes the place look a bit tired. Shame for such a great seat of learning that it is not better cared for. Inside is a different matter of course but needs a make over outside.

title: Beautiful campus, rich in history
text: You can just wander the green spaces of the campus if you wish... tour guides offer info on the history of the statuary and the buildings or you can buy a campus map. Could be the most beautiful campus in the US. Exquisite grounds.

title: 3.5 stars
text: Lots of historical buildings and a beautiful campus to walk thru.  But, you need a map.  And...biggest disappointment...you can't go in most of the buildings, including the libraries.  The Fogg Museum was excellent and the guided tour was great.

title: Great Yard
text: It was just impressive to get to look at such a renowned institution up close and personal.  It is quite exquisite.

title: Lot to see - but requires guidance
text: Everybody has heard about Harvard University, and nearby Cambridge, will want to pay a visit. It is very nice to walk around the Harvard Yard, and take a picture nearby John Harvard's statute. You can walk around and grab something to eat at the food trucks located at the plaza, and kind of have a feeling of how it is to be here for longer. But you will need someone to point you out the details about the buildings and the notorious people that lived and studied in there. You can have a free tour that is provided by Harvard University itself; it will take you about an hour and provide you with the needed information. There are also paid tours, departing from Harvard Square. Be aware that you won't be allowed to enter in many buildings like students residencies and the library. Anyway, it's worthy.

title: Historical and Beautiful to Walk the Campus
text: It is an icon and you should walk the area and the campus if you are in Boston and have the time.  I got dropped off in an uber, bought a little campus map at the informational center and walked the campus.  It is full of history and there are a few little tours that you can take if you want to learn more.  I cannot believe how old that University is and on a cloudy day in the later afternoon there was not one student outside enjoying the Harvard Yard!  Then I remembered...it is Harvard and they are probably all inside studying for finals.....   A beautiful University campus.

title: Beautiful - must see when in Boston.
text: Fantastic grounds and architecture - well worth the visit. Can do guided tours for free at various times of the day.

title: Great.
text: Very extensive campus on both sides of Charles River and also Medical School in Brookline.Nice area to walk among youthful atmosphere and busy people.School of the highest quality, investing a lot of money for development.

title: Nice Morning Walks
text: It's not too crowded on weekend mornings if you start around 8/9a. It's not a huge campus so you can cover the highlights in about an hour.

title: Fantastic
text: Nice buildings and grounds. Did not spend too much time so can't really comment but on a sunny day it could be nice to spend time walking around

title: Beautiful
text: Harvard University is incredible. If you like history, philosophy you must go. Also, it gives great pictures.

title: Don't miss the statue foot!
text: The buldings are beautiful with the New England style. Walk around a little bit and don't miss the foot of Mr. Harvard.

title: Big
text: The campus is expansive but without any maps for visitors to follow.  Suggest doing some research first and identify the sights to see and bring your own map.  For a university campus, it mostly has history going for it but it is not an especially pretty campus.

title: Touring America's oldest (and arguably best) university.
text: Harvard Square is a must see when in Cambridge. The University is our nation's oldest and arguably the best in the world. It's certainly got the largest endowment. It was a treat to tour campus with my son. Any prospective student should visit! Start at the John Harvard statue. Don't miss the library and dining hall.

title: Harvard Square in the rain
text: Sense of academia is palatable - as well as typical coed campus. Nice to celebrate education for such a long period as this school has operated. Keep that going!

title: Take your time -- From an Alum
text:
Take your time.

There is so much history on this campus, it's worth the extra time if you can grab a hotel and spend an entire day (Or more) touring the campus.

In my time studying at Harvard I really enjoyed the history, and I know you will too. 

Slow down, take your time.

title: Definitely a walk to remember
text: While spending the Labor Day holiday weekend touring the New England states, we stopped for a few hours at Harvard University on our way to Newport, Rhode Island.  I have always wanted to visit Harvard and walking the campus on a beautiful summer day, where most of the students are on holiday, was a surreal and refreshing experience. The buildings are lovely and there are quaint cafes around the campus. We, however, chose to grab a bite at Harvard Square. Aside from enjoying the walk and food, we were able to take great pictures.

title: An inspiring place
text: We picked up a tour of the University in Harvard Square at the newsagent's kiosk . About $10 each and well worth it as our guide ( a student ) was knowledgeable and entertaining . The tour lasted an hour and covered stories about how the University was founded, the various buildings and alumni. After that we went to have a look at some of the other buildings as there's an interesting variety of architecture .( you get given a useful map so you can see what's where ) . Lovely place,lovely atmosphere .

title: A class act
text: Stepping into the Harvard university feels amazing. The age, the knowledge and the impact each of those gigantic structures have is eminent in the air. An absolute must go for academics.

title: A Great Walk and A Great Space to People Watch
text: Harvard is one of the most prestigious universities in the world. The campus is befitting of a university of such caliber. It is a very well integrated and beautiful campus. It is great to walk around and take pictures. If you are hungry you can stop by Harvard Square for a bite.

title: Impressive, 1-4 hours
text: If your tour begins with the "recruiting" auditorium presentation, you should plan a few hours. If you just want to stroll thru and see the buildings, you can do that in an hour. It's a fairly tight campus and you'll quickly recognize places from various movies.

title: Really good insight into Harvard culture and history
text:
The tour is free and last one hour which is perfect to get a feel for the Harvard history and culture without dwelling too long. 
I found it interesting and perfectly timed.

title: A must see
text:
You can't come to boston without taking the subway to harvard.
With it many different building spread out vast area.its like small town itself .There is many musium on campus eg natural history to art .you can even take tour around the campus as students as your guides

title: Great to visit
text: I have wanted to visit the sister university to University of Manchester for a long time. It was brilliant to see and feel the atmosphere.

title: About what you'd expect
text: A nice walk around campus. Buildings are lovely and about what you would expect. Plenty of cute eateries and coffee shops around campus.

title: Intellectually Stimulating
text: Who can't enjoy visiting the greatest institution of higher learning the world has to offer? So much to see and do with so much history everywhere you look.

title: Yearly morning stroll
text: Went, saw, no concor....was a great site seen.the weather was cold. With snow and ice. But was really nice to see the buildings, statues and parks.

title: Ancient buildings, beautiful interiors
