text: Home to some of the smartest students on this planet, the architecture doesn't disappoint. It has some really old buildings complemented with beautiful interiors and furnishing. Scholarly landmarks and a Harvard friend who brought me around campus on a tour completed the package for me.

title: For the academe
text:
I took three courses at Harvard through the Extension School.

The quad is teeming with tourists all year round, specially around Harvard Square.

title: Quintessentially New England
text:
We skipped the tour, having done it before on a previous visit, but still enjoyed wandering around the campus in the spring sunshine.  Harvard Yard is beautiful; the elegant Georgian style red brick halls quintessentially New England and has a very 'old money' feel about it, in complete contrast to MIT down the road which is more cutting edge. Do try to fit in a visit to both to see the contrast.

And of course we stopped at the statue of the John Harvard, the 'Statue of the 3 lies', so called because it doesn't depict John Harvard at all, he was the benefactor rather than the founder of the university and the date is incorrect.

Definitely worth a visit.

title: Underprepared
text: We were visiting Boston and took the subway over to Harvard to walk around and check it out.  it was easy to get there and the walk around campus was very nice.  However, I really think we needed a guide or someone from the area to show us the ropes because we were pretty clueless as far as what was located where.   I'd certainly recommend everyone to go see this Institution but I believe you'd get a lot more out of it paying for a tour once there.

title: One of the best Sunday services
text: Went there for Easter Sunday 😊 the service was wonderful.  Loves the church choir😊 it's a definite must see when in Harvard 😊

title: Great visit
text: Take the tour run by students. They have great stories. The price is ok for a one hour tour. The tour guide was a junior student. She knew a lot about the university. I recommend the tour during warm weather for all of it is outside. No indoor access to buildings.

title: Great tour
text: We took the official historical tour--our tour guide was a current Harvard senior. Great knowledge of the University's history and very friendly and fun.

title: Harvard Yard: Prettiest Campus in Boston area
text:
Although not all of the Harvard campus is pretty, Harvard Yard itself is quintessential Ivy League and New England. 

Go to Smith Center (formerly Holyoke Center) and sign up for a campus tour by an underclassmen, filled with funny anecdotes and history.

Finish by walking around the shops, eateries, and bar of Harvard Square.

title: Amazing
text: If u are planning to boston never miss being a part of this tour and enjoying the campus yard and walking around through the famous Harvard square

title: Spoiled of that university, Love it
text: The Famous school of Harvard and the Cambridge, which you should see in your life, The streets of Cambridge are full of educated people , walking down the Harvard Campuses and think about future , that everything will be Positive and All right in your life...Totally was spoiled of intellect

title: The second best university on Mass Ave in Cambridge
text:
So a few famous people people might have gone here. And it's been around for a while. And the campus is nice. But really, with MIT right down the road, who really wants to go here? :-)

OK, seriously, Harvard has a lot of great stuff for even non-students to do. The Harvard museums are terrific; the Sackler (art) and the Museum of Natural History are exceptional.

title: Don't Miss Harvard Coop
text: If you are a lover of books like me, then you should not miss the Harvard massive bookshop (Harvard Coop) located in the heart of Harvard Square. Also has lots of souvenirs for colleagues, friends and family. Loads of fine and casual dining shops and coffee shops to choose from.

title: great college in a wonderful area
text:
harvard yard is a great place to sit.  the freshman dorms line Harvard Yard and worth a visit.  Beautiful campus in the center, but the rest of the college line the streets of Cambridge.
 Top college in the country.

title: Learn a lot at Harvard
text: whether you attend Harvard or simply visit, you'll learn a lot AND learn to appreciated the history, the architecture that is America at its best.  The university itself a microcosm of our world which hopefully will teach us all to be tolerant of each others beliefs, culture, etc.

title: Perfect place for teens
text: every year we lead a group of teens to Harvard. Very educational and inspiring just to walk on campus.

title: Nice history
text: A great walk though the campus. I would have loved to be able to sit i some of the classes to see what the prestige is all about.  My dad graduated there and said it was a great experience.  I went to Howard.

title: Worth a walk through
text: If you haven't been, it's a hodge podge of different architecture. It's a large campus and the people are definitely interesting. Tours are available. It's worth saying you went to say you went, if nothing else. I wouldn't go out of your way if you weren't already going but if you're in the neighborhood it's an easy detour.

title: Impressive buildings
text: Impressive range of buildings surrounding green space with mature trees. Mostly Georgian style large buildings with a few more recent styles thrown in. An impressive campus.

title: College shopping
text: Beautiful campus in Cambridge. Difficult parking around campus. Definitely could use more visitor parking spaces.

title: Everything you expect
text: The history, the architecture, the sites, the buildings and just being able to walk the grounds feels like an honor. I enjoyed my visit and feel everyone should do it if they can.

title: Student Led Tour
text: We did a student tour of Harvard, well worth the fee of $10 per person.  Really insightful and fun with interesting facts.

title: What can I say? It's Harvard
text: A beautiful campus in any season. Our nation's oldest institution of education- it lives up to its reputation.

title: This is one of the best universities ever!
text: We toured Harvard University and it was totally awesome!  There were so many nice places to walk around to.  It was incredible to see the number of students touching Harvard's foot for luck.  It was neat to see some of the dorms where students lived i.e. Mark Zuckerberg.   The Harvard library has a Titanic connection.  Finally, a university police officer offered us a toy Harvard police car.  It was the coolest thing!

title: Must Visit
text: If you are in Boston, you cannot miss visiting Harvard University. During the summers, it's good to walk around the campus.

title: Terrific Tour!
text: My high school freshman daughter requested a visit and tour. Campus tour excellent and highly recommend it for the history lesson. Tours are very popular so be sure to check-in about an hour before tour time to get a ticket (free). Lunch at Mr. Bartley's Burgers after the tour was a hit too!

title: One of the Best!
text: This is an old University with nice brick buildings. Nice places to walk around. Also has Cafes everywhere especially around Harvard Square. Get a Map first, so that you know how to get back to where you parked By the way , parking spots are scarce.

title: Greatest university ever
text: I visited there as a member of delegate from Tokyo to participate in the student-organized conference. So many students there were friendly and warm that I really enjoyed staying there. Buildings are nicely built and I wish I could study there as well.

title: Harvard Campus Tour for Dummies
text: Highly recommend the Harvard Tour for visitors - those of us who will probably not gain admission in this lifetime! We took our three children on this tour when they were in middle school and starting high school. Why not start at the top?  The tour guide was great, the stories were factual and relatable. Who knew about the library? So much to do in Cambridge before or after your tour and of course there is the Harvard book store!

title: Harvard U
text: This is a great place to visit , not only for all the Wonderful different kind of shops , but also for the architect in that area

title: Pahk your Cah!
text: Steeped in history, art, and architecture, the oldest extant university is worth the trip. Do not miss the recently revamped art museums.

title: Good and historical campus.
text: Harvard university has very attractive camus, just near to metro station and welcomes you  "Enter to grow in wisdom'. You are so lucky if you attend a programme there, if you are a tourist you should visit the historical campus which is on the Cmbridge side of Boston.

title: Bucket list.... Checked!
text:
I have always wanted to come here and I wasn't disappointed.  Very easy to get to by train and covered in lovely snow when we did arrive to make it all the more romantic.  If you appreciate history and architecture this should be on your list of things to do in Boston.    

Child and stroller friendly, even our toddler enjoyed the walk.

title: Harvard trip
text: Don't forget to hit the bookstores!  Awesome old building, row house (the water freezing over), the football stadium across the river and the amazing old gates everywhere on campus.  Great athletic facilities and the public transportation was so easy!!  We took. The bus from the airport with our luggage to the subway.  No problem!

title: Very cool
text: It was really cool to walk around this iconic university, learn about the history and imagine being able to study there.

title: An insider view of Harvard Business School
text: I was fortunate to visit Harvard Business School when my wife was a speaker there at a conference. So I had the opportunity to sit in one of their larger classrooms [both as a back bencher and later an eager beaver in the front row]. It was an experience I will never forget. And the walk through the campus on a crisp February Sunday morning was truly memorable.

title: Great architecture and atmosphere
text: We spent 90 minutes walking around the campus, rubbed the foot of Mr Harvard's statue, sucked up the atmosphere of learning and enjoyed looking at the buildings.

title: Regional Manager
text: We went to the book store to purchase some gifts to take back to family and friends. They had plenty  to select from. We were happy with the lay out of te book store.

title: Getting Smart at Harvard
text:
Being in Boston invites for sure for paying a visit to Harvard. Being in a place having hosted more than 40 Nobel price winners is for sure exciting. You can approach such a visit in many different ways.

The hanging out version:

Breath the culture, mingle with the students, start conversations, ask what people like, sit just down and enjoy the atmosphere, stroll around not missing out the library building offering you the exposer to a lot of very individual persons, who for instance just occupy the benches, hang out in the internet, stretch out and sleep or talk with you cause you seem to have time. Like that you'll spend a jolly day and remember for ever Harvard was a place feeling you good.

Making a museums tour version:

You can of course also book or make a tour for instance and you gonna meet the 
Harvard Museum of Natural History, Harvard University Herbaria, the Museum of Comparative Zoology, the Harvard Universitria and the Mineralogical and Geological Museum and if you've swallowed it all, you may remember Harvard is a place making you smart. Such tours can be booked in local tourist agencies and will cost you about 20 dollars (Jan 2016)

Exploring the surroundings version:

Of course even in times of Netflix and Spotify the students love to meet somewhere and getting entertained. Meaning after looking around and enjoying little cafés and bars offering healthy stuff (naturally raised chicken making the premium price of your Caesar Salad for instance) you will find a number of local clubs, to hang out and listen to some good music, playing chess or back gammon in public or dare to sit down and show off playing master mind - just because you may feel so much inspired.

Should you be around in winter times like me don't miss ice skates, because there is mostly an ice scating parcour built up.

Whatever version you choose , have fun !

title: Photos
text: Dropped by the college to see where so many of histories leaders learned and walked. I wanted to "feel" the history, touch it and see why it resonates with so many. Beautiful buildings, nice campus and yes, I felt it.

title: Oozing History
text: Wander through Harvard Yard and feel the spirit of the generations who have attended.  It has a world class History Museum and Art a Museum.  There's are many cafes, bistros and restaurants outside the bricks walls to discuss your big thoughts.

title: A place of importance
text: It's an impressive place, all right! The buildings all have seen greatness, the stories that you feel in every quad and hallway. It's all there. I felt honored just to walk among those hallowed halls.

title: As other reviews have said, It's Harvard!
text: It was amazing to see such a prestigious school but unless you pay for the tours there is only so much you can see as everything is restricted to members. The area around Harvard was really cool though. A lot of little different kinds of shops. It was definitely neat to see Harvard but I wouldn't go again.

title: Relax and take a stroll ...
text:
If you want a view off Cambridge and all it has to offer along with Harvard University itself - WALK!

Walk from HSq. through the Yard and back again ... THEN  walk along Massachusetts Ave. towards Central Square, have lunch in Central Square and the walk down River Street to the Charles River and circle back to HSq.
ENJOY!

title: great place to visit, too many visitors during the peak summer days, parking is a challenge to see this place.
text: great place to visit, too many visitors during the peak summer days, parking is a challenge to see this place.  Harvard University products are quite steep in their prices, but, if you want to pay that much by all means, traffic is a challenge be ready for this.

title: Neat experience
text: What's more iconic Cambridge than Harvard Yard? Definitely a must-see if you visit Boston or Cambridge. Venture a bit farther than just the Yard, though, and check out the architecture along the river, and even walk across to visit Harvard Business School. Plan on a lot of walking. There's plenty of restaurants, shopping, and bars nearby if you need a break.

title: Harvard
text: Nice tour of Harvard University. It was snowing when we went, but It was nice to walk around the campus.

title: It's Harvard afterall..
text:
Probably one of the things I was most excited about seeing while in Boston, was Harvard University. I mean, it's Harvard afterall, one of the most prestigious universities in the world. 
Harvard University is located in Cambridge, just a short metro ride out of downtown Boston. Once in Cambridge, it isn't hard to find Harvard University since it seems that the little town sprung up because of the University. Book stores, coffee shops and cafes line the sidewalks of Cambridge; everything I had always imagined this little place would be. I love it! 
Once on the campus of Harvard, just walking around is the perfect tour, as the college seems to speak for its self with the beautiful architecture and tree lined sidewalks and walkways. The campus offers tours, but I would suggest looking on line for further details on that. 
I suggest grabbing a picnic and a good book, and sitting under one of the many old trees on the campus. The hustle and bustle of the students going back and forth, the professors running here and there, all make for the perfect afternoon at Harvard University.

title: Harvard Tour
text: For the sake saying I have been there you can visit this place that's it. None of the building have any sort of wow factor or any sort of charm. You will require a guided tour or else it will be boring.

title: Very Nice
text: We went there in Januari, it was very cold. The was no tour for the moment, but we walked around and had a very good time. Harvard is a must see!

title: Everybody should pay a visit to Harvard
text: One of my bucket list places was Harvard and I recommend everybody to go there. It is a special university and the area is beautiful. This is a special place:)

title: Beautiful and peaceful gardens in the summer!
text: Walking there I thought that Harvard students are extremely lucky to study in such an environment. Harvard gardens are huge and beautiful, it is the perfect place for a break, a chat or a nap. It was a real pleasure to roam around and discover the buildings, sculptures and museums. If you are visiting the famous campus, keep time to walk in the gardens!

title: cool
text: It is very cool to know Harvard because it's a very well known university. it has a lot of historical buildings and constructions. Besides that it is just a school.

title: The foyer of Memorial Hall is memorable!
text:
We visited the campus on a cold night prior to classes starting.  Most building were locked up.  Still I thoroughly enjoyed walking through and reading the various plaques.  We were able to go into Memorial Hall, or at least the foyer which is reminiscent of a castle or grand estate home of a prior century.

Take time to read as many plaques and historical markers as you can.

title: Grand Seminar at HBS
text: Visited HBS for a seminar on Healthcare: it was mind-blowing. So much insight, knowledge, performance and a big inspiration for healthcare at large and for my personal enterprise

title: Don't expect grand buildings
text: I was a bit disappointed, the buildings were quite flat and block-by-block type, no interesting "British" architecture. It was in holiday so it was like a ghost town.

title: Must visit!
text: Walking the historic grounds of Harvard was such an experience! EVery building, every walkway, gate, literally EVERYTHING is beautiful! If you have time while in the Boston area than definitely make an afternoon trip to Harvard and eat at one of their pubs.

title: It's Harvard!
text: A historically significant place of higher learning and thought provocation.... go and check it out. It's a small city with shops, restaurants, book stores, in addition to the lecture halls and residences.  Find Mr. Harvard's golden shoe and rub it for good luck.. grab a meal, listen to some music and enjoy!

title: An iconic place
text:
Visited it in a heavy wet snow.  I find the surrounding really convenient for students.

Harvard itself stands out on its own in terms of academic excellence but getting in is a different story.

title: Must Visit
text: Do not miss Harvard Yard. Take a photo in Widener library steps, John Harvard statue, and say a prayer or two at the Memorial Church. Lots of restaurants to choose from, and also get a souvenir at the Harvard Coop store.

title: overrated and expensive
text: cool kid club. snotty nosed rich kids run around Boston. Worse than expected. If you want Ivy league visit yale.

title: Mythical!
text:
I already completed my post-graduation, but I must admit that I felt quite attracted by what this mythical College offers to its students during the free presentation I attended. Those presentations are actually for potential students and their parents, and you might find it a bit long if you are not there to apply, but it is quite interesting, it is free and it is followed by an interesting campus visit.
If you visit Boston do not skip Harvard, it is a beautiful place full of fun stories and museums. You can plan a full visit there (easy to access by public transport from Boston).

title: Worth a visit if in Cambridge
text: Combine a visit to Harvard Yard with a trip to their art museums across the street. The  historic campus is beautiful but can be cold and windy in winter.

title: Not a lot to see ....
text: The buildings are nice and it has a nice tanquil environment, in contrast to the surrounding area. Because of the history I am glad I went to see the square. However, unless I missed something, there is not a lot to see!

title: Historic, not much to see or do
text: I have been to Harvard a couple of times, and every time I go, there really isn't that much to see or do. Yes, it is cool to be on the grounds of Harvard University, but besides walking around a big open grassy area, there isn't much! Go see John Harvard and take a picture touching his foot!

title: Amazing trip
text:
I visited Harvard as a tourist and was amazed. The campus it's self is beautiful, the atmosphere is very chilled and there are lots of tourists around taking pictures. The surrounding area has a lot to offer as well, retail shops and souvenir shops , places to eat, cafes etc. you can make a day out of it visiting Harvard or just take a quick trip there as the train form Boston city to Harvard is only around 15 minutes. 

Harvard was everything and more than you would expect from seeing it in movies and is defiantly a must see if in Boston. 

Hope this helped missmemoir.com

title: Beautiful buildings
text: This is a very beautiful campus. It is a bit smaller than I had expected but it is steeped in history, and there is a lot of interesting stories behind the buildings.

title: So historic
text: When you walk through the campus, one can't help but feel the history of this place and the inspiration one feels walking to classes every day inside the campus. Beauty is that the subway station Harvard is just next to it.

title: Coop Bookstore
text: One must see Mr. Harvard's statue and see the brass rubbed bright on his left toe - something strictly "forbidden" to do, but of course, everyone does it.  Fun to see the campus known all over the world.  The coop bookstore across the street is a delight to any book lover.

title: Beautiful fall visit to historic campus
text: Toured this entire campus, beautiful buildings and squares, loved natural history museum and the plexiglass beehive. Something to see.

title: Harvard, what a stunning huge campus
text: I went to Boston one weekend and started my visits at Harvard. It is easy accesible through the subway and really close to downtown Boston, about a 10 minutes ride. The campus is so beautiful, with buildings from the seventeenth century all connected by green spaces. Lovely. I would recommend to take a tour to learn about its history too.

title: Huge Campus
text: Took a stroll on the Harvard University yard on an evening visit to Harvard Square. I was surprised the gates were open for tourists to roam the yards. We did see security, so that seemed safer than we imagined. The campus is HUGE. The buildings were beautiful. I wish I could have booked a tour to really see the historical buildings.

title: Harvard
text: Best university on earth. The campus is ver quite. Students look smart :) you should pay a visit for the university and take a picture with the statue centered in the garden. There is a museum for science and space. You gonna love it!

title: Harvard
text: Seen Harvard many times over the years. The yard does not equal that of the University of Virginia.  But it is still Harvard and definitely worth seeing.

title: Day trip
text: A really enjoyable place to visit, so much to see beautiful old buildings, lovely grounds and great unusual stores especially the tobacconist, Leavitt & Peirce store opposite Harvard library. Checkout George Washington Elm tree and African American burying ground. The only down side was so many homeless.

title: Historic!
text: Although visitors are not allowed in most buildings, it is possible to walk around campus.  This is a must see if you are in the area.  The architecture of the buildings is amazing.  We were able to go into the church which was beautiful and were fortunate enough to experience live music from the huge organ on the second floor (were were there on a Sunday around 10 am).

title: The University!
text: I had wonderful experience at Harvard. Harvard graduate experience stretches beyond its colleges. I had incredible education and experience at Harvard!

title: Official Harvard tour
text: They offer tours for free about every hour in the Smith center. There is no need to pay for the student tours by the news stand or the T. Our guide has helpful in explaining Harvard to us and we walked around for about an hour. We enjoyed it.

title: Great piece of American history, with array of attractions
text: If unfamiliar, sign up for the historical tour, available to general public.  Also take a self-guided tour, and be sure to visit the museums on campus.  A great walk through history and storied academia.

title: The oldest institution of higher learning in the United States
text: Harvard University was founded more than a century before the American Revolution.  By now this most well endowed institution sprawls out over much of Cambridge and neighboring Boston.  The architecture of the undergraduate campus is impressive.  They house such fine institutions as the Museum of Natural History, which has a great collection.  One irritant:  the library is completely inaccessible without a university ID.  This seems unnecessarily effete:  I don't want to check out books, just browse.  Nonetheless, my wife, daughter and son in law enjoyed strolling about the grounds

title: Nice tour of Campus
text: We were at MIT for the splash program over the weekend and took the opportunity to go see the Harvard Campus and tour it.  Nice experience,  and helped my daughter get a better grasp of what awaits her since she has her mind set on attending this School.

title: my dream about place to study
text: visit this place is an obligation when you're in Boston. Feel here climate science and American tradition

title: Feel so intelligent.
text: Just walking at the Harvard makes you feel smart. But be warn these place is a tourist magnet so there will lots of tourists on tours here at times. Come after 6pm if you want to enjoy the tranquility and feel as though you are a Harvard student yourself.

title: A no brainer
text: You have to have a look at this, the most important place in Cambridge. Some fine buildings and a great atmosphere.

title: Gorgeous campus to explore
text: Finally made it to Harvard!! A beautiful campus with more US history available to explore. Awesome architecture and gorgeous grounds.

title: Take the Student led Harvard Tour !
text: This was such an enjoyable free activity! We began the morning by grabbing a quick breakfast at Peet's in Harvard Square. But we were disappointed that they don’t toast bagels. The day was a perfect, sunny, crisp fall day with lovely reds, yellows & golds just spilling from all the trees. You register for the tour up to half an hour before it begins. Our tour guide was a current Harvard student who was so entertaining, funny & personable that it made the time fly by. He assured us we could ask him anything & he knew all the fascinating historical facts behind the buildings we visited which helped everyone truly appreciate the surroundings that much more. Don’t forget to pass beneath the massive iron Harvard gate that students must pass beneath twice while at Harvard – once when they enter the school & once when they leave upon graduation. Afterwards, we wandered through the massive Harvard bookstore nearby to buy some T’s & souvenirs. We discovered that right next door to the bookstore is a street vendor selling some of the identical T’s & sweatshirts for much less !   So explore a bit but definitely take in the student led tour.

title: Experience studying in HBS, simply awesome.
text: Went to the main building of Harvard Business School, with the environment and setting, no wonder it is one of the best college in the States. Don't miss it on your trip.

title: Institution of Depth and Beauty
text: We have had the honor to visit Harvard for four years. Each visit we see more and admire the history and commitment to the educational experience. Tour the campus and do not miss the amazing museums, rich in history and exhibits. Do not miss walking on the Charles and delighting in the architecture.it truly is a spectacular institution that deserves the number one rating of colleges. Cambridge is filled with fine restaurants and lodging choices.

title: Great Tour
text: We had a great time during the tour. We all learned some pretty cool facts about Harvard and its history. Great for kids and adults.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Harvard university is definitely a must. It's full of green areas, magnificent buildings and cool young vibe. Students are very chatty especially when they hear a foreign language they don't recognize :)

title: Nice to see it in the flesh
text: Having seen Harvard in numerous films etc, it was nice to just have a stroll around the leafy grounds admiring the buildings. Worth a visit if your in Boston.

title: Campus Meeting
text: If you're visiting Boston and looking to explore some of the historical attractions in the area I would recommend a stroll through Harvard's school grounds.  It's a truly majestic campus with old hardwood trees and beautifully architected buildings.  The energy from the bustling of students between classes is enough to make one stop under a large tree and dive into a good book.

title: Diversity Explosion
text: If you're in the Boston area, take the Red Line to Harvard Square and walk around. The people, stores, restaurants and the air will open up a whole new world. You will never be the same regardless of the time of your visit. In the Fall is the best time because the colorful leaves create an ambiance you will not forget. It's not too cold or too hot and perfect walking weather around the Charles River to view the heavenly scenes. All throughout the year you will bump into tourists and people taking in the Harvard air...go visit - you won't be disappointed.

title: A nice walking tour
text: Decided to do our own tour of Harvard using an app we downloaded. We were there about 2 hours. The architecture is lovely but there isn't much else to marvel at on an autumnal morning. Glad we did it and we got the tshirt, as they say!

title: Beautiful colours in the fall!
text: The Harvard University Campus and its surroundings definitely have a special feeling to them. There is a lot to see and the trees are simply beautiful around fall. Whether you are a student or not, it's worth a little visit. Don't forget to rub the "John Harvard" statue's left shoe for good luck ;)

title: The Hahvahd Tour
text: We went on the Hahvahd Tour on quite a dull day, but our day was brightened by our super tour guide. The tour was really interesting, and as we didn't know anything about the place, we loved hearing all the facts. There is an old world charm to the buildings, and we loved all the stores. A great tour, not to be missed.

title: Particular feeling
text: Always interesting to walk around the campus and spend ime in Cambridge city center. Quite a special place that revolves around a common passion for studies and success. No easy to find elsewhere in the world.

title: Absolutely Beautiful Campus
text: My wife attended a graduate training at Harvard and I tagged along. This opportunity allowed me several days to roam about, explore the rich history of the campus, and experience the wonderful people around Harvard Square. This university is so pretty in the Fall, and I thoroughly enjoyed my time on campus. I highly recommend if you are in Cambridge to tour the university.... I just feel so much smarter now! 😃

title: Legendary university with legendary grounds
text: There was a street festival complete with a parade the day we visited Harvard University. This was a complete surprise and we enjoyed watching the parade and seeing all the groups represented. We strolled along the walkways on the grounds of Harvard and sat in chairs under some ancient and beautiful shade trees. There were students giving tours if you are looking for information. We just wanted to enjoy the grounds and the people watching.

title: its the mecca of education
text: its an amazing place and feel is magnificent. the libraries are larger than life and the atmosphere is serene. the place  gives a very positive vibe.

title: The old and the new
text:
We caught the red line from Boston and arrive in Harvard Square. The trees in the walled University behind us were just changing colour and it was a hub of activity with students and tourists mingling. We decided to take an organised tour as it would be hard to see everything from the map 
Worth a visit

title: From Connecticut to Gaby: Our Wonderful Tour Guide
text:
I went on the Free tour with a good friend and we had a great time! I believe our tour guide's name was Gaby. She was awesome! I loved how real and authentic she was. She was extremely knowledgable. The best part of going on the tour with Gaby is that she always made people feel comfortable to approach her with any questions. She did a fine job talking about the financial aid process. This is by far the best college tour I've ever taken! 

I was unsure of the gratuity situation which is unfortunate because she was stellar!

- Cory and Elaine

title: Beautifull surroundings!
text: The surroundings of Harvard University are very nice. There are always free tours that you can take if you're interested in learning about the story of some of the buildings and the university

title: A place to call home
text: I studied at Harvard, but I still enjoy going there.  There are some hidden places on the campus to see.  Try the Divinity school yard, have lunch at the business school.  There are always lots of events on the campus and so if you are around, please do visit.  A few other things you may want to visit is the observatory, and the many museums on campus.

title: Tour was great.
text: We had a walking tour of Harvard and it was very interesting.  Our tour guide was animated.  Loved the stories she told.

title: What can I say- An Boston Institution
text: If you go for a visit you can truthfully say you have been to Harvard! We were on a motorcoach tour and stopped by only for a brief period, but Harvard is a beautiful campus rich in history.  If in Boston, then I would highly recommend making a stop at Harvard and Harvard Square. You would not regret it!  This is one attraction that will not cost you a penny.

title: A living history book.
text: Take time to walk around the campus and you will see history come alive.  Posted around campus are plaques commemorating important events over the last 300 years.  For example, the freshman dorm housed troops that fought in the revolutionary war!  Make sure you go into the main library.  It has fascinating architecture.

title: Overrated
text: Are people reviewing this place as a university, to get an education? Or as a tourist site? It's a pretty poor tourist site. A handful of old buildings, some really great museums (both art and natural history). But the campus itself is not particularly photogenic. The old campus is ivy covered brick but that takes a2 minutes to appreciate. Also, parking is terrible.

title: Beautiful grounds
text: Beautiful grounds  to walk around. We took one of those tours of the campus and we were so amazed at how lovely and charming it is. The guide told us that unlike Yale and Princeton, Harvard doesn't have to fake being old. 😀

title: Boston's #1 tourist attraction
text: ... by number of visitors, for good reason. It's the most prestigious university in the world, and a major historical site, with several excellent but not-too-large museums. I recommend a campus tour, though these are variable, and a visit to at least the Fogg Museum (fine art). One interesting thing about Harvard is that it's not physically impressive compared to many larger campuses across the country - it's not all about buildings.

title: Community Treasure
text: Plenty of lectures and museums for the public, and a sterling place to get an education.  I know because our family has done so for generations.

title: dream university
text: take your time to visit Harvard, spend sometime at the cafes, book stores and parks around Harvard uni.

title: Worth Seeing
text:
This is an icon of America and should be seen. It is an experience. I would describe it as a bee hive.There a people everywhere walking talking someone from all over the earth in one place. They make a beautiful collage of sight and sound. These students and visitors seem to fall into an easy cadence. These kids do not seem rushed or anxious. The campus is full of seats and toys. ie; the colorful chairs in the square and the exercise stations on the walk way. Make sure to check out the shops and  eateries in the mall entrance. Don't over look the lunch trucks. A walking tour is fast paced and full of information that you can not see by looking. There is a lot to see and may not be accomplished in one visit.
It is good for home schooling, dates and people watching. The students are dressed in enough interesting garb that photo studies of them in contrast to their surroundings would be fun. a trip to the museum should be a specific stop as there is so much to see. There is a cafe and in court seating.
This venue is in town. The space is smaller than anticipated. Parking is at a premium.

title: Wonderful student-led tours!
text: Harvard is a magical place and it's energizing just to walk the campus. A great way to do this is to visit the Information Center (just next to Au Bon Pain at the center of Harvard Square near the T stop) and get a ticket. It's free. The tours are led by students and, in general, are really well done. It's fun to hear the tour guide's stories, along with some fun history. If you're in the area it's definitely worth a visit and a tour.

title: Interesting buildings in a lovely setting
text: Go for a walk around the campus area. The buildings and gardens are wonderful. Close to T-stop on red line and close to shops at Harvard Square.

title: Architecturally beautiful!
text: We went on a walking tour of this campus that was given by a student.  I highly recommend doing this so you can appreciate what you are looking at and learn the history that is all around here.  Beautiful buildings all around.  So pretty in the fall with the changing leaves also.

title: A visit may be as close as you will get.
text: We really enjoyed our visit to Harvard it is so cool . Lots of history. We walked around the campus and it was so busy. Being from Canada the tuition is expensive to say the least. It really makes you feel good there. We stopped and looked at statutes and walked the grounds. It is well worth the visit.

title: Beautiful Grounds
text: Visiting Cambridge with friends brought us to visit Harvard University and the Harvard Yard. The grounds are so well kept, clean and peaceful. Just walking around enjoying the gardens and architecture of all the buildings was enjoyable!

title: Mike & Micah Lose a Bunch of Kids in the Woods
text: Amazing play at the Loeb Theater at Harvard. Yes, my daughter has a non-speaking role in it, but it is the writing that stands out in this play. Many of the small details of growing up, friendship and making your way through college are presented in a most relatable and funny way. My wife and I are still discussing it. One more weekend remaining.

title: An invigorating place.
text:
We spent the afternoon here, we wandered around the campus, taking in the atmosphere, enjoying the beautiful architecture, sitting around on the colourful chairs, people watching. We didn't bother with the tour, but there were plenty of tours to be had.

We were lucky to see the trees in their Autumn colours, it's very beautiful place to visit.
We went into the Natural History Museum and the Peabody museum. It was disappointing that you couldn't go in any of the churches. 
Lots of great places to eat and drink in the town. There were some market stalls along side the campus, selling fruit etc and some snack bars selling food and drink, but we waited until we were back in town.

title: Country's Oldest College
text: Cupolas with weather vanes adorn many of the old buildings on this lovely wooded campus.  Harvard Yard is not unlike many other college campuses with its wooded diagonals crossing from buildings added around a long rectangular central yard.  The only downside is the sheer volume of people in such a small area.  It must have been much quieter in the 1700 or 1800's.

title: The Official Harvard Tour and a glimpse of Harvard University.
text:
I was in Massachusetts, USA, and since I was visiting a cafe near Harvard University, it was only natural for me to visit Harvard University. As I had only about 2 hours to spend at Harvard University, I decided I could get a glimpse of some of the highlights of Harvard University by attending one of the Official Harvard Tour.

The Official Harvard Tour has its earliest tour of the day start at 10 a.m. As I was in Harvard area very early, I signed up for the tour way before 9.30 a.m. I subsequently learnt that it was helpful to be early to sign up for the Official Harvard Tour. The tours were so popular that the 10 a.m. tour was fully booked before 9.45 a.m. However, as registration starts only one hour before a designated tour, it does help to plan ahead the visit to the Harvard Events and Information Center in Holyoke Center so as to secure a place on the Official Harvard Tour.

The Official Harvard Tour was led by one of the student volunteers. In addition to attending the Official Harvard Tour, I bought myself a copy of "A self-guided walking tour of Harvard Yard and surrounding areas".

The Official Harvard Tour brought us to various locations on Harvard Yard such as the Massachusetts Hall, the Harvard Hall, the Science Center, the Memorial Hall, the Widener Library and the site of the John Harvard Statue.

I love the spaciousness of Harvard Yard, and it was a lovely experience being there on a day in summer.

During the tour, I learnt that the Memorial Hall is the building whereby first-year students of Harvard would dine in so as to foster a sense of community. The Massachusetts Hall is the oldest building that is still standing at Harvard. I felt privileged to be visiting Harvard University which has a long history.

It would be nice to offer a gratuity at the end of the tour.

If any one wants more after the Official Harvard Tour, I heard that there is a fun alternative to the Official Harvard Tour. It's the Hahvahd Tour.

title: Always visit, at least drive thru, when in the area
text: Maybe it's being around all those smart people and feeling the history but we always visit when in the area.  The area has changed since I was in college at a nearby school but in so many ways it is the same.

title: Jealous of kids studying here
text: The campus is just gorgeous, full of green spaces and historic buildings. I visited the campus on my own, spent more than 1 hour wandering around the campus and then Harvard Square. Put aside at least 2 hours for the visit to the school and the area around it. There's just so many thing to see and you have to take time to enjoy the scenery.

title: Harvard Yard  - Definitely worth the visit
text: Harvard Yard is very much at the heart of the University and dates from the founding of the college. It was freshers week when we visited and it has a lovely atmosphere and many impressive buildings including the Memorial Church and the Widener Library.

title: Interesting and educational
text: nice neighborhood, lots of restaurants and close to transportation. Be ready to do some walking inside the university, beautiful buildings and lost of history

title: Definitely Worth the time
text: As a retired teacher, it was a real thrill to be able to walk the grounds of Harvard.  I was mainly interested in seeing Memorial Hall and the Science Building's first computer, and these did not disappoint.  I had done some research on what we wanted to see and where it was located on campus, so we were able to walk the grounds around 8 a.m. in a self guided tour.  Some of the buildings were closed for special services, like the chapel, but it was still nice to get to see the main section of Harvard from the outside.

title: An Icon of Higher Education
text: Harvard is one of the foremost Universities of the world. The campus is a beautiful blend of old buildings side by side with new modern structures. The streets and squares reek with the history of modern day science and the philosophy of inventions and discoveries. The Statue of John Harvard the founder is a popular spot where most tourists love to take a picture holding on to the founders brass boots. It is so popular that the tip of the shoe alone sparkles( due to friction from regular touching) while the rest of the statue is black.

title: You must go there
text: A very good place to study and to go around also. Beautiful gardens and people give us all directions.

title: Its like a dream come true.
text: Visiting the Harvard Business School during my Boston Visit was like a childhood dream come true. I spent 4 hours at this place and also attended a MBA class as a visitor. The way the education is delivered, the way the students interact and the facilities in the class are indeed unique and modern. Especially the Tata House that made me proud as an Indian.

title: Student led tour of Harvard Yard is excellent!
text:
Visiting Harvard University is just a subway trip away from Boston.  The meeting point is very close to the red-line Harvard Square station.

The tour is led by students and operates every hour on the hour.  It is led by students and is very informative.  The tour lasted about 1 hour.  Go to the Harvard University website to find out more about their student led tours.

The campus is a nice stop when you are in Cambridge!

title: Beautiful campus
text: Gorgeous campus with plenty of picturesque places to sit, linger, and contemplate all that is wonderful about Boston. Step in the arched brick campus walls and you are instantly enveloped in history. Beautiful old trees shade walking paths through the grassy quad. The farmer's market is an added bonus.

title: An excellent, fun walking tour
text: This tour which lasted 70 minutes and cost only $10 was led by two Harvard students, Joe and Martina. They were so entertaining,  and gave us loads of information about the university  as well as a lot of amusement. Well worth doing!

title: Nice way to spend an hour or two
text:
We enjoyed an hour walking round Harvard Square and Harvard Yard. We meant to also visit the book shops but there was an Oktoberfest street festival going on so we got waylaid!

The food trucks at the other side of the yard were a nice surprise and the ice cream was particularly welcome on a hot day.

title: If only......
text: Harvard was like stepping back in time.  The campus was quaint and smart considering the locality to the city.   I sat under a grand tree for an all time photo! ! wonderful

title: one of the most prestigious universities in the world
text: We were not able to roam around for a long time but I was still in awe with this university. This is a highly recommended spot to visit when in Boston.

title: Excellent Tour!
text: Tour was excellent! Highly recommend. Perfect amount of time and information provided by current students.

title: Excellent guide, Ted, makes for an interesting tour of Harvard
text: Excellent story telling, interesting facts, enthusiastic delivery and just the right length of time to be walking around on a beautiful Tuesday in Boston.

title: Has to be done !
text: Take a tour but even if you don't want to do that , you have to visit this place . The most prestigious, famous , oldest , richest , best university in the world . 6 US presidents . Bill Gates ! Mark Zuckerberg ! Etc. Etc. . Beautiful grounds , pleasant and helpful students , beautiful architecture ( most of it anyway ) fabulous stories . History , history , history !!

title: want to know how they keep down the squirel population with all those nuts on the ground. .
text: Really guys how can you not enjoy walking around this campus with beautiful trees, historic buildings. killer museums and interesting people.

title: One beautiful place nested on the Charles.
text:
Walk all over Harvard Yard, Take pictures in front of the John Harvard statue.
Some buildings look like Harry Potter (Annenberg Hall),

title: Harvard great place to visit
text: We took a walking tour with Jacob,  it was  interesting, funny and great for us and the teenagers.  He is one of the students that works as a guide.

title: Relaxing and Beautiful Campus to Visit
text: We visited on a beautiful fall afternoon and spent time in Harvard Yard, as well as walking around campus.  The campus is beautiful and tranquil.  Many visitors and tour groups mingled among the students, as all enjoyed time sitting on the yard in the provided chairs.  Take some time to walk around the campus and see each of the unique gates that allow entry to the older part of the campus.

title: Educating!
text: The tour guide was a young student and did an excellent job in describing the history, the student life and the studies they undertake. Very informative and amusing.

title: Amazing buildings
text:
Never visited an American university before, but was amazed by the Harvard campus. Amazing buildings. It was great to walk in the halls of Harvard law school. 

It is a nice visit.

title: Cool
text: Loved my tour guide Jenna she was funny and informative and a student at Harvard I wish we could've enters the buildings but all in all out was good I got to hear cool stories and just see harvard

title: How Prestigious!
text: I came upon Harvard as I was running alongside the Charles RIver on my 1st trip to Boston. At first I couldn't figure out what those lovely buildings were. The only time I had seen Harvard was in the movie Love Story! I ran through the campus and later returned to have lunch in Harvard Square. A trip to the Harvard bookstore was well worth it!

title: Lovely university town.
text: Nice place to walk around. It's a city by itself - it has restaurants and a square where you can walk around and be entertained.  There is a Thai Restaurant that serves delicious food at reasonable prices.

title: Excellent free tour
text: Free tours can be had and altough we thought we may have to wait until the next showing they fitted our large group in immediately.  The tour lasted around an hour and the guide was excellent funny and hopefully provided interest facts about the history and culture of the campus and university.  Ps if you want a building named after you donate lots of money.

title: Exciting to be here...but needs some grass
text: Walked thru harvard yard about 3 times...went into a few of the buildings...loved the art museum...but the square is just a square with little grass...i liked that they left chairs out in the middle for folks to sit...and places the tour guides could chat with their tours...

title: It's just a busy crossroad - not a real square
text: This is a good place to meet as everyone Knows the place + all hotel shuttles stay there but there is nothing to do other that visit the shops. Harvard Yard right near it is a much nicer place.

title: Lovely grounds & architecture!
text: We visited Harvard University in late August, which meant the grounds were very quiet. Lovely gardens and architecture. Perfect for an hour or so stroll of an afternoon. Due to the time we arrived, we could not enter any of the buildings, but the grounds themselves are well worth a look!

title: Visit Harvard - Quaint, warm and charming
text: We were touring universities and Harvard was a must see on the list.  It's in the heart of Cambridge and feels like a small town within a city.  It's exactly what you expect but so much more.  As you casually walk the grounds, it's relaxing.  Make sure to rub the foot on the statue.  It's for luck.  Ask a student, they can explain the story better than a quick review.  While your at it, get a T-shirt to take home.

title: nice walk of high rank university
text: nice campus！great institute！ worth to join one tour for the visit，otherwise there is no sign of information.  tour is one hour，if you don't have enough time, a leisure walk is also very pleasant.

title: Fun tour by Harvard sophomore
text:
A fun 1 hour tour led by Harvard sophomores. Our guide,  Carmack,  was a lot of fun.  He really has a lot of knowledge about the history Harvard as well as about the architecture of the place.  He also combines a lot of humor and anecdotes from the campus life.  Jokes about Harvard's main rival,  Yale,  are a big part of this tour as well.  
The tours go out every 30 minutes and start just next to the Harvard metro station.  
10$ well spent!!!

title: A Tour Worth Taking
text: Harvard tours are led by Sophomores (2nd year graduates) every 30 minutes at a cost of $10pp plus tips for the guides. The tour takes about 70 to 75 minutes and provides an opportunity for photographs as well as questions of the tour guides. Our guide (Derek) was exceptionally good with a sound knowledge of the history of the University that was established in 1636 by the Massachusetts Bay Colony. It adopted the name of its first benefactor, John Harvard who donated his cow pasture as the site where most buildings now stand. Unfortunately, entrance to buildings is not available to the public but nevertheless, the tour revealed many interesting historical facts.

title: Impressive Ivy Campus
text: Harvard University has a gorgeous campus in Cambridge. The buildings are beautiful and it is a great place to roam around for a few hours taking in the rich history. The campus book store had reasonably priced items too.

title: Excellent
text: Harvard  is still excellent university due to the great effort made by the founder at that time,  when education is a must for better future. We feel very proud by touching the feat of the founder. Harard with  its name has huge potential in education fields. Our visit to this university was part of tour of this city.

title: Lovely campus!
text: Great campus, excellent tours and lots of nearby cafes and restaurants. Harvard yard is a great place to hang out for a while

title: Impressive institution
text: On of the best universities in the world. The campus is just amazing, too bad visitors are not allowed inside, however the gardens, buildings are just amazing. You can feel the history around you...

title: Venerable and inspiring bastion
text: Venerable top-ranked institution, inspires awe and admiration from one and all.  A mecca for aspiring students, hopeful parents and grateful alumni.

title: Family vacation
text: Was great to see in person this great college and feel the history around it. Took awesome pictures wIt's the John Harvard statue. The feel of the campus is warm and inviting.

title: Good to see
text: Its Huge! Only because we were in boston and had a vehicle we drove to see the University. Its huge in our standard of university. We were glad we seen it, but it wouldn't be something I would rave about that you need to see.

title: Good to visit only if you're in the vicinity
text: Everybody knows the Harvard University by name, so since I was in Massachusetts, I decided to make a trip to visit this renowned university. However it wasn't a great welcome for me as it was quite a pain having walked the entire yard only to realise the 'visitor centre' for the tours is actually located OUTSIDE the campus building.. After we finally reached the centre, we were told that the hourly tours were fully booked and we had to wait for the next hour. Opted to purchase a $2 Harvard self-guided tour map which turned out to be the better choice because that allowed us to choose which sites to visit and see and which to skip rather than to go to every single one which can be time consuming and to some extent boring or repetitive. Don't get me wrong, the place is nice but having been to other famous universities, Harvard does pale somewhat in comparison and isn't really worth the traveling out just to see the school.

title: Nice to visit, but I wouldn't make a special trip
text: I took one of the tours led by a Harvard student (recommeded) and they did a nice job.  Much better than me just walking around on my own.  It was nice to see the university, but somehow I expected "more".   Not as much "wow" factor as I expected.  (By comparison, I thought Stanford on west coast has a "wow" factor).

title: Beautiful but we expected to be more impressed by the #1 university in the world
text:
Don't get me wrong, Harvard is a nice campus. Is has a lot of history and is actually pretty impressive. But as a university campus fanatic, I am more looking at the architecture. The style at Harvard is beautiful. The thing is, I was really expected to fall on my back. I have bean a student at McGill in Montreal, and our campus is known to be stunning. I guess it may be hard to beat it, but I have seen plenty of pictures of other american campuses that are wonders of architecture. Sadly we did not have the time to pass by, but I think MIT offers more on that matter. I did love the school of business though. 

Important point for anyone planning to visit, it is VERY LARGE. Plan for at least 2h00 to visit the most important schools and be ready to walk A LOT. 

A good tip: there is free wi-fi as you arrive at Harvard Square. Take the time to download the PFD map of Harvard, which can be saved in Ibook (for IPhones...). Saved me a lot of data to get around the places.

title: Nice place to walk around any season
text: Harvard is known to be intimidating and traditional, however, when you visit the school and the square you discover that it is really welcoming and diverse. There are several entrances to the main Harvard yard and students, families and couples walk around and do various things including picnic in the summer and fall. In the winter is it a great place to sit and appreciate the serenity of snow and see students from all over the world passing by. They could have more sitting areas inside the main yard, but just outside of it they have several restaurants and cafes. It is wonderful to hear locals play their music and at times perform.

title: Fascinating
text: Harvard is Harvard; walking around the gardens and all these buildings is an amazing experience, very inspiring

title: Excelent free tour
text: Get to the information Center for a brucher.  It's a road all across the University that tells you the story of each building. Also, the students make guided tours for 10 dollars each.  Only in English.

title: Its just perfect!
text: You need A LOT of time if you want to see everything this amazing campus has to offer. We spent 2 hours here and didn't see nearly enough. It is so historical and such a wonderful and inspiring place. I can completely understand why there is so much hype about it now and why it is such a great place to go to school. Jealous of anyone has attended, I would love it! But I will just have to settle for more Harvard sweater, and pretend like I went there.

title: Inspiring!
text: My wife and I were heading towards Fenway Park and decided to drive thru Harvard.  It is an inspiring area and you can't but wonder the type of pressure the students in this University have in order to obtain a degree from this University.  It was a beautiful, peaceful place and the drive by was certainly worth it.

title: You Can Feel The Tradition of Centuries!
text:
We are in Boston for 3 days and decided to explore MIT and Harvard.
Both are landmark institutions that defy categorization.
But Harvard is the quintessential University!  It is referred to deferentially by all who have dealt with its graduates.  
To walk the Yard, see the buildings, feel the traditions - it was well worth our trip out here.

title: obvious why it's one of the US top universities
text:
We visited the university in July, when it was reasonably quiet....lots of tourists around, of course, but everything was easy to see.
An impressive Ivy League university....one can understand why it is the first choice of so many students!

title: In an American campus
text: In this university you can have a nice walk in the yard and discover the different buildings to find out everything about this famous place. For us it was a very interesting tour!

title: Worth the walk to Harvard !
text:
We took a ride over to Cambridge and decided to tour Harvard.

The campus is obviously quite nice and certainly worth walking around.

There are students outside the campus near the Coop that will give you guided tours for cheap, we just walked it ourselves. You can not go inside the various buildings for obvious reasons.

title: Great university in another Cambridge!
text: John Harvard was a student at Emmanuel College, Cambridge, hence the names for the university and the place. Being a Cambridge graduate, it feels quite special to visit Harvard. It is a lovely place to have a pleasant walk. We always visit Harvard whenever we are in Boston.

title: Worth a visit
text: Harvard University is worth a visit... You grow up hearing so much about this ivy league school, that it is very interesting to take a tour of the campus and see it in person. Great town surrounding it too- just like every ivy league university town.

title: A pleasant walk around but ar gallery now charges
text: Harvard is an quick ride on the subway - we got off at Harvard Square and went back from Central. The new students were just arriving so there was lots of activity. This is a must-see in the Boston area but we were disappointed that there is now a charge for the art gallery.

title: Stunning buildings in an iconic setting
text: About 15 minutes on the subway from the city centre. Great to stroll round and soak up the atmosphere. Overall campus is massive so unless you make a day you will only see a small part. Beautiful buildings to admire

title: Salute to the Great Harvard University
text: Late evening walk at Mass Ave with my daughter near Harvard square and later we visited the great educational Harvard University. Saw many tour guides explaining its glory and splendor to the people visiting all around the world. Saw people taking pictures at the Harvard Statuei side the entrance of the university. Time worth spent here.

title: Nice to walk around
text: However difficult to find which direction to go. We wanted to do the tour but after being sent in different directions we gave up.

title: the student harvard tour was fun and funny
text: we took the harvard  tour by the students. and it was well worth the  10 dollar tip we  gave. few hours of walking learning and laughing.  great times  great memories

title: the House of Culture
text:
When you walk among the University buildings you can feel the history and the culture that this place contains.
Worth a visit if you are in Boston

title: Highly recommend Hahvard tour
text: If you only have a short time to visit Harvard take the red line train from Boston city centre and get off at Harvard Square. The Hahvard tour guys are just outside the station when you arrive. A Harvard student will give you an amusing tour of the university and explain its history and culture for the grand sum of $10. The tours go every half hour. Our guide was Ross and he was very informative and amusing but I'm sure any of the guides would be. After all they are students at Harvard.

title: Ugh
text: An obscure, undeservedly pretentious university in the middle of an otherwise highly educated city with a proliferation of superior higher educational institutions. Sally's Pizza, the Harkness Tower Carillon, and Mory's are far too distant for this backwater to be a credible center of learning. Go Yale!

title: Well Worth a visit!
text:
Easily reached from Central Boston on the red line T. It's fascinating to walk not only around the yard but down to the Charles River past the beautiful buildings that are the students and staff houses. 

There are a wonderful variety of places to eat and drink & spend a pleasant afternoon people watching!

title: Worth the time
text: It was great to just walk around the campus of this institution...we were lucky that an alumni struck up a conversation with us...that led to an impromptu tour!  Worth the time!

title: Extensive
text: Excellent place, excellent school.  The school campus is massive.  Its like an entire community. It has its own police force and everything else you will need.

title: Curiosity
text: You might have curiosity to visit the world most prestigious university. Don't forget to visit Harvard Yard and the statue of Harvard. The Collection of Historical Scientific Instruments is interesting, but it is just opened on weekdays from 11:00am to 4:00pm.

title: Lovely walk
text: We independently toured the grounds.  It is a beautiful campus, filled with history, and we felt quite welcomed.

title: Student Led Campus Tour
text:
We were walking around Harvard Sq. and my kids wanted to see the Harvard campus. I've walked through the yard many times, but never had taken a tour before. We bought tickets at the news stand in the square and went off for our tour.

Our guide was a student named Cormac who was a rising Sophomore. This tour was excellent! Took the family and kids (middle school age). Cormac was energetic, enthusiastic, had a great sense of humor, and very informative. He kept the tour entertaining and educational at the same time. 

I would definitely recc a student led tour if you want to actually learn more about the school, campus, and architecture as opposed to just walking by the buildings.

title: set some rules
text: Let's revive an old debate.  The Yard will look and feel much better if you put some caps on tour crowds and eliminate the spaghetti of asphalt walks.  Students and tourists alike can follow rules.  Pave some nice paths and ask people to use them.  It will look better.  It will save more grass.  It will make people feel better about being there.

title: The student led tours are the bomb!
text: Always wanted to see Harvard and stepped right into the student tours as we got off the subway to Harvard square.  the only way to see the campus as the student led tours have all the fun stories.  Our guide even sent us to a  fun restaurant not loaded with tourists.  Actually the campus has\d more tourists than students.

title: Goosebumps as I drove by
text: I did not go inside; I just drove by.  That said, I got goosebumps knowing I was driving by one of the top 3 Ivy League schools in the US!  When I drove by, I saw ivy growing; hence the category of Ivy League School.  The ivy does not seem to be present in this pic, however.

title: Lovely campus
text: Harvard University campus has kept many of its historical buildings and monuments. It is also a nice place to chill either within the campus or in the surrounding vicinity.

title: Great
text: Great University! It is really worth it to visit this place! There are many beautifull places which one can see.

title: Harvard
text: My first visit to the worlds number one University and I enjoyed it immensely. Old and stately it is a place to be seen.

title: HARVARD
text: Wonderful place to visit with really great museums, gardens to walk around, and the architecture of the buildings.

title: Tour Harvard with Helana
text: Helana is the best tour guide I have ever experienced. Not only was her tour educational, it was both funny and informative. Most importantly, she told us things we are going to remember when we review our photographs.

title: Wonderful place
text: Just a wonderful place walking around with so much history. Kind of a magic place. Even if it is often a lot of people here I find it peaceful and calming. I always discover something new.

title: Great experience
text: Beautiful, picturesque university that is so well integrated into the surrounding city. Took a walk around the Yard which was an oasis of peace and green amongst the buildings...

title: A Taste of History
text: Beautiful Campus.  Loved that it is one of the oldest Universities in the United States  It made our history come alive.

title: Campus is good but too many tourists
text: Been there for campus visit.  Better take public transportation or it will be hard to find a parking space.  If you have to drive there, make sure to book online for one of their parking garages before you get there.

title: Great feel at Harvard University
text: The ambience of the campus is just amazing,it was so refreshing to walk through the yard and see the library,the dining hall and have coffee at Harvard Square.

title: History!!!
text: The parking on Sunday's is free, but you may have to really search for that spot. The history on this campus is a journey back in time. It should be visited by all. The

title: Take the Official Tour of Harvard University
text: Take the tour! Tour leaders are engaging and quite humorous. The campus is beautiful and historic. Try to go inside the Harvard Memorial Church and view the memorial tablets on the walls of the sanctuary.

title: Beautiful campus
text: We took the free student run tour and it was pretty informative. The campus is beautiful and right by Harvard Square, which has many options for food and shopping.

title: Anticlimactic
text: It was...there. Nothing like Heidelberg, Sorbonne, Tubingen, Oxford, Cambridge-or even Notre Dame or Galway. It is as overrated and boring as many of its alumni.

title: It's Happening at Harvard!
text:
Harvard University and its courtyard were spectacular!  It is one of those experiences, free of cost, that leave you in awe.

The grounds were verdant and the structures were majestic and rich in history.

There are tours led by Harvard University students. I learned some fascinating facts, like women were not granted the same degree as men until 1998.

There are some restaurants nearby that you could take a break. I highly recommend you to explore this oasis in Cambridge.

title: Disappointed with Harvard Yard
text: If you go here make sure you do some research first as there is very little in the way of information around Harvard Yard itself. Go down to the tourist information point and get on a student led tour to get the best out of your visit.

title: An another gem in Boston
text: Who does not want to be a student in Harvard? When we visit the Austin Hall, Faculty of Law, we felt the legal flavours everywhere. Library is a uniqe piece. Gardens are better than the parks even better than the Lafayette Park in DC, much green and well maintain.

title: If you're in Cambridge you have to go to Harvard
text: It's everything you expect from Harvard.  There are Harvard students in Harvard Square that can give you a narrated tour of the university.

title: Famous school
text: It was fun to see such a famous place and hear amusing stories during the tour, e.g., the three ‘lies’ on the statue of John Harvard (wrong name, wasn’t the founder and wrong year) and what was the most expensive building per square foot (the guard station).  I’m not sure I believe the stories but it was fun.  I liked that there were chairs all around the main campus (see photo). Too bad the place is so out of touch with the rest of the country.

title: Lovely place to explore
text: spent a wonderful day walking around and checking out some of the buildings..worth a visit and would like to return

title: A quick visit
text: Walked around Harvard Yard, beautiful campus with lovely old ivy-covered buildings. Tons of people touring and classes weren't even in session.

title: No just for students
text:
If you have the possibility to visit Boston, you cannot miss visiting this beautiful place.
It just takes 10 minutes by subway from the center of Boston.

title: Harvard
text: The visit to the Harvard University was inspirational and memorable. We took photos of ourselves touching the shoe of the statue of Harvard who contributed generously towards founding the great institution which is nearly 500 years old

title: Eye opener on student info session
text: We took our high school age children to Harvard and MIT for info sessions and tours - all in one day.  MIT was nice but Harvard was excellent - the info session was insightful, led by an admissions counselor and 2 current students who gave their opinions, answered questions and had a rapport with the counselor that made it engaging.  It was far from the stuffy atmosphere we expected.  There was an emphasis made throughout for everyone to get the feeling there was a family atmosphere at Harvard.  The video presentation at the beginning was entertaining.  The student-led tour though was somewhat disappointing and while we know some of this may be due to the personality and knowledge of the student leading it, we never went inside any buildings - dorms, classrooms, library or any others; meanwhile at MIT it was more immersive and we felt like we knew what life would feel like there through our own eyes, not just what was told to us.

title: We love our walks in Harvard
text: We love walking through Harvard Yard when visiting friends in Cambridge. I am hoping the history and prestige of being in the environment inspires my teenage daughters! Great places to eat in Harvard Square and several outstanding museums throughout campus.

title: Student tour
text: The student information lecture was fabulous and inspirational. Followed by student led tour that was just so-so because we didn't get to go inside any of the buildings.  Student tour guide was energetic and informative.  Biggest complaint is the severe lack of public restrooms on campus.  You have to go across the street to the campus center and wait in line for a really smelly and dirty bathroom.  I would think Harvard would be better equipped to serve visitors.

title: Number one university in the world!
text: This is a spectacular university with beautiful old buildings...and some less beautiful new ones. Best to take a free tour with a current student which leaves from the center of the square near the subway entrance. Lots of history to learn and the students do a great job.

title: Great visit
text: Attended a course at the Havard Business School. Was very impressed at the professionalism and the facilities which are modern and provide a conducive study environment.

title: The most beautiful campus ever
text: If visiting Boston, make sure to leave room for the beautiful Harvard campus. We signed up for a guided tour, lead by one of the student, and it was truly lovely. It was fascinating to learn about Harvard's history and to catch a glimpse of life on campus, daydreaming about how it would have been to be lucky enough to study in such a wonderful institution. The Harvard bookshop is also a goldmine - make time for it, but avoid my mistake: I was holed up there for two hours :)

title: I got a lump in my throat thinking about all of the great figures that walked these same paths as I was!
text: So beautiful. So full of history. Such a prestigious University. I found it inspirational to poke around in some of the buildings and walk the campus of our country's first College. If you love US history and/or visiting various institues of higher learning, then this is theplace to go!

title: Beautiful campus
text: I was in a tour group when I visited the campus.  As such, we only got to see 'highlights' of the place--Al Gore's dorm room, etc. A very nice campus.  I would have liked to spend more time strolling around.

title: Campus Reflects Why This is One of the World's Greatest Schools
text:
Although visiting Harvard was never on my "bucket list," I knew that visiting Boston would include a visit to this hallowed institution.  

I didn't take the tour - but went with a friend who had attended Harvard (and who now works at MIT).  The campus is magnificent (bring good walking shoes!), and to try and explain everything I saw would be diminishing the overall scope of the place.  Lots of incredible/older buildings, green space, history - you name it.

Also, go to the "edges" of campus and you'll experience street performers, shops, and food trucks.

title: Take in the history and see all the sites!
text: Talk about history, architecture and fun people watching!!  This and Harvard Square are terrific places to visit.  If you want to get up close and personal, you will have to walk since you can't drive on much of the campus.  It is a great tour though!  You'll just feel smarter making the decision!

title: Motivational!!
text:
Thanks the the amazing guide Oxana, my tour group learned a great deal about the life of a Harvard student and the history of the University.

I cant praise her enough

title: Great summer program at Harvard!
text:
Although the weather at Cambridge was rather odd dropping some 14degC from 21degC to 7degC in a day on 31 May (Sun), the temperature climbed to a comfortable 20degC by the end of that week and it made walking around the Harvard campus so pleasant.

The Harvard campus is well-organized so getting around campus was easy.

title: What a place !!!
text: so much history...so many camps...so many buildings to visit...bring your camera and just pose. Is a total spot to visit.

title: School was better than tour
text: Harvard, as a university, is a must see in my book. I am happy to have seen what it looked like including the layout and architecture.  We took the free tour (didn't realize you need to sign up an hour early) and our tour guide didn't go to Harvard. She seemed nice but that was hard to get past. The tour was ok.

title: Beautiful place. Worthy visiting!
text: Many people visit Harvard, so you have to wait for seconds to take good photos.  There are non-fee official tour guide, just find out the information center and you'll have a great experience. (Don't forget to give them tips as encouragement! They explain really well)

title: Entertaining!
text: So much information with a humorous twist! Our guide Jeff F. Was awesome! Learned many things about Harvard! Our guide was charasmatic and good looking. I enjoyed all of his stories and came away well informed!

title: Beautiful
text: We visited as part of an organised Boston tour and it was just as lovely as expected and small enough to see in a short time.  Would love to have had more time to see round it.

title: Excellent Seminar~
text: I spent a week attending a seminar at the Harvard Graduate School of Education & LOVED it!  It was very well organized & valuable.

title: Good tour of he campus
text: We went to the recommended official tour, behave of the others as this one is free where the others are charging. The tour centre is in Holyoke and you must come an hour before the tour at the top of the hour. The guide was a graduate from Harvard, who better than her? Enjoyed every minute of the hour we spent there!

title: Loved it!
text: Should have done the tour! But we didn't realize it until we had to go. A tour with the college students is well reviewed and we missed out. We walked around ourselves after getting a map from a student at a store and she told us what to go and see. Thankful for her! Beautiful bldgs and lots of great history.

title: An Inspiration1
text: While Oxford and Cambridge Universities may protest, and Princeton and Yale may disagree, Harvard which was founded in 1636 making it the oldest institution of higher learning the United States by far is the greatest in the world.  Visiting here which I have done as a student and guest is always inspirational,

title: What an amazing insight
text:
