Our son touched John Harvard's foot hopefully to bring him back to study here.

title: A great place
text: We checked out this uni when we were at Biston. The campus was great. My son was so inspired.

title: Meh, just okay.
text:
This is one of those places to check off on your "I've been there" lists, but that's about it. The campus is old and has a few nice buildings. Overall, though, the architecture is not that impressive and the landscaping is mediocre at best.

Those who have toured campuses like UVA, Indiana, or William & Mary will not be impressed.

The building were closed but we got to sit in Harvard Yard - of course she loved that.  The buildings were rich in history and even the gates were beautiful.  We walked around the area and stopped for some pizza close by.  It was an enjoyable visit.

title: historical place

title: Great

title: HU

As soon as you arrive on the square, you feel a nice, vibrant atmosphere. Immediately you will see the students who will guide you around on Harvard. The difference between old and new on and off the university is worth to see. The old buildings (for the US) are beautiful with attached history.

title: I don't belong here
text: March 2004 - Spent an morning/early afternoon walking campus.  What an amazing campus!  The architecture and ornateness gives the feeling of "elite of the elite".  The only campus I've visited that felt more blue blood was Yale.  Impressive all the way around

title: It just is.
text: It's just Harvard...the reason I give it three is that it is overrun by tourists. I'm a student in the area and it's kinda annoying.

title: Harvard University
text: Our class of 21 enjoyed our time touring Harvard University. We got to see all of the iconic places in Harvard. We saw the Harvard yard and during our trip, learned many interesting facts about this Ivy League school. After visiting the yard, we went to the library, all of the freshman dorm buildings, the freshman lunch area, the presidents office, the science building, a building with the names of all of the civil war Harvard students, and finally, we stopped at the Natural History Museum in the city of Cambridge. The also has many other shops you can stop at after visiting Harvard. Enjoy your time!

title: Lovely for an afternoon walk
text: Join a free tour at Harvard Square T run by college freshment (who work for tips) and get an interesting insight into this amazing university.  Or take an afternoon stroll with a LIzzy's homemade icream in hand. Make sure you wander through some of the off-campus buildings, such as Harvard Business School or the under-grad dorms near cnr JFK and Elliot Street.

title: amazing history
text: Being the oldest university in the new world, it has a ton of history.  We went on the student tour and found out a lot of amazing facts.  We didn't have time to fully explore the campus and know we missed some of the best parts like the arboretum,  Too bad they only allow Freshman into the elaborate dinning hall or library, but understandably as it is so popular.  The Peabody Museum is worth the admission fee.

title: harvard university
text: just walking around the campus and surrounding area is a treat. the grounds and buildings are beautiful. rich in history. always something happening.

title: Must visit
text:
Spend at least half hour or few hours.  If you only have half hour, go to see the statue of John Harvard and touch his left shoe!
Walk few minutes around the 6-7 Harvard buildings and get a great feel.  

For anyone having more time and/or wishing to know more about a history you can take a tour or just attach yourself to any walking tour passing by.  In summer time/weekend there are lots of them happening.

title: Was expecting more !!
text:
Ok so it's Harvard and historic and one of the best institutions .. but looks matter !! I mean the campus is nothing special at all, there was no "oh wow" moment while walking through it.

Was irritated by the end of the visit.

title: Great place to stroll
text: Without a Harvard ID you aren't getting into most of the buildings, nonetheless, it's really cool to visit this campus. The gigantic entryway to the library is majestic.

title: Gotta be done
text: Lovely place, lots of history and anyone who's remotely academic will appreciate this but it is a bit of a tourist trap, as you might expect.  Go to one of the tours given by Harvard students.  Go visit MIT which is also in Cambridge-greatly underrated but just as big a contribution to the world of science and technology.

title: Walk in the footprints of history
text: Founded in 1636, Harvard is the oldest university in America.  Take the time to stroll around the old Yard, walk up the steps of Weidner library and reflect on all the great minds and famous people who attended this great institution.

title: Beautiful campus
text: The history of the university just reaches out and grabs you. Lovely place.

title: Don't miss graduation!
text: Harvard yard is ALWAYS beautiful, but the week before graduation it is festooned with banners of scarlet and gold -- making it still MORE beautiful!  Find the great boulders set into the pavement in front of the science center for a good sit!

title: Proof that money and the false promise of a better education don't change the world
text: Feel free to see for yourself, overrated. Harvard square is great though and your dissapointment will be disapated by the local street vendors and timely establisnments that a true free market can provide.

title: so nice, except for the tourists
text: love that the chairs are back out for the summer. also loved the ice skating right near there at the science center this winter.

title: average
text: easy to get to and a must see but smaller than i thought.

title: A must-see when in Boston
text: We didn’t get to catch a tour but just walking around the old red brick building was fantastic. There was actually free art festival while we were there which allowed us to peruse through some of the buildings and listen to some music.  The church is probably one of the most beautiful buildings on site and it is worth your time to stop by and take a peak. Very easy access to Harvard through the red line train.

title: Amazing university to tour and experience
text: Just walk around and see the historic buildings. The tour is free and informative.

title: Harvard Square
text: Fun, interesting, easy to get to on the "T". We went to a free lecture onthe Historyy of BBQ which was great, and there was a free beer and bbq tasting afterwards. Score!

title: Visiting the University's historic nucleus.
text:
Located roughly in the center of campus, Harvard Yard is the oldest and arguably most celebrated portion of the campus.  It is roughly divided into two portions: The Old Yard (western third) and everything else, the latter including the Widener Library and Tercentenary Theater.  I toured here first as part of a group (Hahvahd tours – see separate review) and then the next day on my own with a tour book.  While at first this may look like a “group of old buildings with a statue in the middle” I’m happy to report that looks in this case are quite deceptive.  Many of these buildings are Centuries old and have history dating to the pre-Revolutionary War period;  Massachusetts Hall at different times housed John Adams, John Hancock, Sam Adams, and a contingent of the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War.  It seemed at every corner I ran into something historically significant (JFK’s dorm), artistically intriguing (John Harvard’s statue) or both (Holden Chapel).

You won’t be spoon fed information while walking around here (sorry, no fancy descriptive plaques or audio guide) but Harvard Yard is as much an integral part of American history as anything else in New England.  Highly recommended.

title: A must see if in Cambridge, whether or not you're a student
text: It's beautiful and historic and got great energy, plus it looks exactly the way you expect a top-tier Ivy League school in New England should. And Harvard Square is right there.  Take a tour if you can.

title: If you've been to Cambridge UK, this is dull.
text:
Americans are very proud of Harvard University. They have buildings dating from the 1800s and lots of advances and studies have been made there. Harvard is unusual in the US, as I understand - redbrick buildings laid out in courts and quads and serious people wandering around thinking serious things. 
Unfortunately, I come from the UK, which has both Cambridge and Oxford universities with buildings dating back to the 1400s and older and the whole place just reeks of history, if that's what you're looking for. 
I understand I could have taken a tour, but the tour that was pushed quite heavily around Harvard was (unsurprisingly) the "alternative and unofficial" student tour, where you pay a student to tell you about their wacky student lifestyle. I didn't fancy that much either. 

I really can't think of much to recommend about Harvard University. As the title says, if you come from the UK and have been or lived in Cambridge or Oxford, or have visited them, Harvard feels very much like a poor relation. But if you've never been to either, you might find it a bit more interesting.

title: EXACTLY what you would think...
text: Amazing...but it is EXACTLY what I pictured.  I love Harvard Square and the bars that are around.  Lots of SMALL bars...not a lot of sports bars.  If you want sports...head to TD Area.

title: A Must
text: Impossible to leave Boston without walking around the gardens of Harvard Univeristy

title: A Must
text:
It is on of the best universities in the world. Even though I am not a harvard student, but I go there for events and having such a good time walking and relaxing there.
I remember once I went wit my school and had a tour there, you would really smell a great history and future as well.

title: Take the student run tour (no costumes :-)
text: We had a very bubbly tour guide who just loved the school, learned the history of the school and was excited to share it with the group.   My son who is only 13 was inspired to want to go there after hearing this girl.

title: Harvard Tour
text: Make sure when you visit Harvard you go on the Harvard tour. It is run completely by the students. It was the highlight of our trip. :)

title: You can miss it if you are in Boston
text: I learnt through internet that there were free visits organised by the same university so we went. We showed up at the departure point a couple of minutes earlier. In our group were about 40 people and our guide was a freshman student from New Zealand. He took us around the square and showed us the most important buildings as long as he told us about history, studies and everyday living in the campus. It took about an hour and was very interesting. I strongly recommend it!

title: Campus is nothing special
text: We all agree Harvard University is an excellent university providing outstanding education, but the campus is nothing special. Apart from the name and the ability to say "I was at Harvard" there is not much to see at this venerable institution. Walking around MIT is far more interesting due to the presence of architecturally interesting buildings.

title: Apart from the Name it's not Much
text: The name "Harvard" continues to attract tourists regardless of the merits of the sights to be seen. There is no doubt that the Harvard University is a top-notch university, but its grounds, buildings, square have nothing special to commend. One is not transformed to a "Harvard" alum by virtue of having visited the campus, square,  or yard.

title: College shopping, disappointed
text: My feelings were mixed about Harvard. We are shopping for colleges and have been west and came to Harvard expecting the same kind of experience. The campus was lovely but bus loads of tourists were being dropped off and walking around in large groups. We did not see signs to direct us to offices where we could get information. We could not get into the library without an ID. I understand how exclusive the school is but they still have to be competitive.

title: A Must See in the Cambridge/Boston world
text: Widner itself is a centerpiece of Harvard, with Richardson to the left of this picture and other grand buildings nearby.

title: An architectural marvel--Richardson to the Modern
text: A must see. Many especially from other parts of the country who did not attend Harvard are surprised how small it is. Makes it even simpler and easier to see the Yard.

title: A landmark institution
text: Harvard is now 375 years old and is very stately and picturesque.  Classes were in session and as teachers we were very interested in seeing classrooms .We found a professor to let us peek in on one of the buildings.  It was awe inspiring to think of all the great minds who had passed through those stately gates to study.

title: Beautiful history
text: From the museums, to Harvard yard and all things Harvard, you can spend an infinite amount of time looking around Harvard University.

title: You can breath history
text: I go to the yard as often as possible, mostly when I have visitors that want to see Harvard.  But in general, you can spend such a nice time just strolling around and checking out the buildings around it as well as the students rushing in from their classes, etc. Bring some food/snacks and have yourself a picnic if you wish.

title: great tourist destination
text: Great to walk around and see the history. It s nice that you can go in without a fee and see the area

title: My husband is a student here!
text: Very beautiful campus! We occasionally go sculling down the Charles River. My hubby graduates in May! I will miss.

title: John Kennedy spoke there just before being sworn  as President
text: Freshmen stay in te 18th-century dormitories that line the "Ya'd."  Rooms where Kennedy and FDR lived can be pointed out by more informed persons than I.  I was there when JFK spoke.  It was an exciting moment in my life.

title: Don't miss it
text: When I have guests coming from out of town, I make sure to never miss taking them to Harvard Yard. It's one of my favourite places in town.

title: Disappointed
text: I was very disappointed, I guess the images you have of this great college are just better than what is there.  Beautiful buildings but nothing to tell you about them and the people were not friendly.  Great bookstore though.

title: Barker Center - nice conference place
text: This was a very convenient place for the literary conference I attended.  Nice rooms and easy to find.

title: I feel smottah now
text: Ok I went to a different school but I can still say I went to Hahvid because I did.Several times in fact as a visitor.. I feel much smottah because of the experience. If you love history, nice restaurants nearby, old architecture, oh and you must go to the Peabody Museum on campus, you will love this place.

title: BEAUTIFUL
text: Harvard is a beautiful campass no matter what time of the year.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Harvard is a great place to walk around and look at some beautiful buildings, historic statues, and large lawns.  The setting is really lovely.  The surrounding area of Harvard Square is a wonderful place to browse stores and have lunch or dinner at the nice variety of restaurants.

title: You Can't Not Go
text: It's Harvard for cripes sakes!  Gorgeous campus.  Harvard Sq. is eclectic and fun, offering great restaurants and hip stores.  Oh and don't forget John Harvard's for you beer lovers.  You won't want to leave.

title: Historic
text: Harvard does a great job of making sure tourists as well as prospective students get a chance to see the University. There are certainly no frills but just the sheer size of the University and all of the history that goes along with is, makes a trip to Harvard worth it.

title: At one time George Washington slept here !!
text:
General Washington borrowed Harvard Yard in July ,1775,to use as Americas first Army base during the 11 month long Siege of British occupied Boston. Washington filled the dorms and classrooms with his new US Army, and Martha came to live with the General. 
  Harvard U. was already 139 years old when the American Revolution began. 8 US Presidents have Harvard degrees.

title: A Fabulous Place!
text: The campus of Harvard is an exciting place to visit. You can sense that wonderful things are happening for students here. Walking around one sees history and hope for the future.

title: SUCKS........so badly...it's not funny
text:
Who the hell was the architect of Harvard??? It sucks! Ugly buildings, red-bricked walls everywhere....it feels like I'm in an abandoned factory in Europe where the windows are cracked (not in Harvard) and the buildings look soo old and unattended....

The only nice places are the Yard, the Dining hall (the one that looks like a Romanic church....yeah....are we in harry potter...?) and the Biology Building, which is my favortie, it has a beach volleyball court in the middle, and animals bas-relieves all over their walls representing different animals in Latin; and then two copper rhinos guarding the entrance and the doors are also sculpted with golden insects and such.

title: It's nice to be outside, they have chairs, uncomfortable tho...they could spend a lil' more on them after all the money
text: It's a nice place, well lit, not too many trees but enough to have multiple shadowed spots. Nice grass/field, chairs to seat, hang out, have lunch

title: Harvard rocks.

title: Look, but dont touch the statue of John Harvard!

title: Historical Grounds Worth Visiting

If you are in the Boston area, you'll enjoy a visit to Harvard.  Beautiful brick buildings and a sprawling campus right in the heart of Cambridge make this a worthwhile visit for sure!

title: it's harvard.

what can i say? 
most  visitors to boston want to and do visit harvard.

title: Harvard Summer School <3

title: Worth the trip to go play tourist
text: Regardless of any opinions you may have about Harvard and it's place in higher education, this place started it all so it's worth a trip to check it out. It's such a unique campus environment, enveloped by a community born out of the University.

title: It is what it is
text: If your goal in life is to see common areas of iconic institutions of higher learning,please go.I will be in Harvard Square having fun if u need me

title: Yard work
text: It may take a bit of work to get connected with a tour to check out Harvard Yard, but it's worth the effort. Ask a student or two about the tradition of rubbing John Harvard's boot.  It's Harvard's (not so) best kept secret.

title: What can I say? It's the best!

title: Harvard University is great
text: Harvard University is great place , the history ... the people ... the atmosphere is second to none !!!

title: Great, historical and beautiful university.
text: Well I work here, so I have to give it a great review! Honestly though, Harvard is an amazing place. If I were visting, Harvard would be on my list to see and take a tour. The history of Harvard is really interesting and they are doing unbelievably innovative things here. Everyone should walk through Harvard Yard at least once in their lifetime! Harvard Square is also known for great food (better than in Boston, I think) so grab a bite while you are here!

title: Have to go there.

title: As of Dec 2011 - closed to public
text: Just want to let potential visitors that as of Nov or Dec 2011, Harvard Yard is mostly closed to the casual public.  Only Harvard University members (students, faculty, staff, etc.) are permitted to walk within the gates with photo ID.  I imagine if you're on a sanctioned campus tour, it's fine - but if you're just in the area and want to walk around for a few minutes, unfortunately it isn't permitted.

title: It's an experience
text: Went through harvard yard during December.  They have their own occupy movement going on.  It's a great people watcher location

title: Christmas Revels
text: A great, great time was had by all. If you like to sing and be merry than this is your ticket.

title: First thing u should do if u are a student
text: It really feels good when u are arrive in the harvard subway station and start looking at all of those people who are propably the next presidents, nobels etc, and just look like hurried kids..The place is inspiring and full of history, the walking tour they offer in Harvard square is worthy, specially if u are a student or if u like those american movies. It feels like you are a part of that for one day.

title: Worth a visit
text: Went on a tour, very interesting, guide very helpful, friendly and informative. You don't need to be an intellectual to appreciate it.

title: Great visit to a historical institution
text: We spent an afternoon in Harvard Square and a couple of hours in Harvard University. Visit the Student Services office located across the street from Harvard and sign up for a free student-led guided tour of the University campus.  Our tour guide was very upbeat and told a few stories of the Universtiy's buildings, traditions, and great stories of the school.  The tour lasts about an hour, but it's a great way to learn a great deal about the school and history.

title: Harvard has so much history and character.
text: We are most impressed and pleased with the quality of education our children are recieving.  The feel of this place has such a rich feel of history.  The age and quality of the buildings and the architecture is amazing.  We were there right after the leaves had fallen off the trees and it was still beautiful.  We have to come back in the Spring and Fall.

title: A great day out with T.S.Elliot's room mate!
text: Our Freshman guide, Lenzo, really was terrific. We were the only people on his tour that day (which was free but voluntary donation is welcomed)but he showed no sign of disappointment at having to spend a couple of hours in the company of a pair of pensioners! Indeed he went out of his way to instill his enthusiasm for his university into us. He did the whole tour walking backwards while talking to us about the buildings we were looking at. He had many anecdotes to share which made the tour interesting and fun, including the fact that he was living in T.S. Elliot's old dorm - how cool is that!

title: Visiting our daughter
text: We are always so impressed with the architecture and style of all the Harvard buildings.  Every time we visit our daughter we manage  to see something new and exciting.

title: They locked the gates
text: Because of "Occupy Harvard" you could not get onto campus unless you had a valid student ID.  People come from all over the world to see this campus, and it was just a shame we had to walk all the way around to get to the museum and theatre were were attending.  There has to be a better way to police the encampment and keep the students safe but still let visitors see the campus during the day.

title: You actually can't go on campus so don't bother
text: Really disappointed you can't actually look around campus so I wouldn't bother :(

title: Cant get in there
text: Unless you have a student ID, nobody is getting into Harvard Yard because stupid Occupy Harvard is in there making their mess.  I travelled all the way to see the Square and was stopped by 3 rude cops.

title: A must to see
text: You sense the atmosphere of intellect and culture and amibition

title: OK
text: Some really interesting nooks and crannies, but Oxford/Cambridge it ain't. Oldest buildings of some interest, otherwise pretty utilitarian.

title: Pretty spot - interesting history
text: We took a bus from Boston to Cambridge and stopped right outside the Harvard University Information Centre on Mass. Ave. A tour of Harvard Yard was just about to start so we joined on. The tour is free, but a donation is requested. The tour lasted for over an hour and was conducted by one of the students, Emily. She was a very good presenter and told us lots of interesting facts and stories about the history of the university and its buildings, as well as her experiences as a student there. Her enthusiasm for the university was infectious. Harvard Yard itself is a beautiful spot, but the tour brought it all to life, with explanations of what happens where, and who does what. We weren't really expecting to do the tour, but we were so glad we did. If you are visiting Harvard, try to get on a tour - it's much more informative and entertaining than the self-guided brochure.

title: A famous University to visit
text:
This is a university campus you must visit because of all the prestigious that Harvard has. You will see the statues and historic buildings that made it famous.

You can easily take the subway from Boston to Cambridge, there is an specific stop at Harvard University. There are many gift stores and restaurants in the area to enjoy as well. You can also tour the areas around the campus which are easily accessible by walking.

title: Great Afternoon lounging and enjoying Harvard Square
text: With an afternoon to spare I decided to bring the family to Harvard. I figured with 12 year old twins they may be inspired to work harder at school when we got home. Harvard square is a great little trendy area to enjoy a Java and kick back. We sat in a park and just people watched. If Harvard is stressful you sure couldn't tell by hanging out. Spent 3 hours just roaming around campus and I'd recommend for anyone looking for a relaxing afternoon in Boston. Kids enjoyed many of the shops and appreciated the institution.

title: Check it out!
text: An interesting place to walk around and explore. Looks like it does in the movies :)  SOme good places to eat around and very lively area on the weekends in the evening.

title: The center of "Capitalism"
text: Take a tour of Harvard Yard and shop at the coop. Make sure to eat at a local restaurant to get the flavor of a great school.

title: Good Academics, Bad Attitude
text: The academics and opportunities are unbeatable, but there is a bit of an elitist air (I hate to say it) and they don't treat medical leave students well.

title: The "free" tour was good, it just wasn't free
text:
A good day trip from Boston on the subway, especially if you have an interest in higher education. The museum of natural history had some pretty good exhibits on glass flowers, minerals, evolution and such things. Art museum was ok.

The "free tour" advertised and run by Harvard undergraduate students was quite good, however it should more accurately be described as a "tip-only" tour. Everyone was expected to tip $10 each (or $20 for family) - this sounds like a scam, but give the tipping culture, is actually not that out of place in USA.

Our guide regaled us with interesting facts and history about the university, the town, and of course the famous students that studied at harvard over the years.

title: An oasis
text: When you walk through Cambridge, people and traffic are everywhere.  Then you enter Harvard Yard--quiet, interesting architecture, and a chance to see where higher education began in the United States.  You can stroll at your leisure.

title: Visiting our Granddaughter
text: It is all the hype says it is. Our grandaugher who goes there showed us around. Most impressive.

title: Must see
text: This is a must see place in Boston, plus plenty of places to eat.

title: Very impressive!
text:
We took the guided tour offered, given by students of the university.  There was about 50 people in our group, but since the tour is mostly outside, it didn't feel crowded.  From what I understand the group was large compared to what they usually get, it was the high season.  The student spoke loudly and clearly, and was quite amusing.  It was very interesting to hear about each of the building - the tour wasn't as much about the history of Harvard as what happens in each building today, and how life is on campus.  The guide was quite candid in answering questions about why he thinks he got in, how much it cost each year, etc., but would preface every answer by making it clear that it was his own experience.

The tour lasted about an hour and it was interesting throughout.  It is free, but the students are not paid, so the only money they make is from the tips that they get.  We gave our tour guide $10.

title: Not a lot to see
text: Not really a place to take teenagers.  The Coop bookshop was excellent but the area whilst architecturally ok is not really of interest to teenage boys. The clothes shops were! If you are staying in Boston I would use your time there.

title: Iconic Institution-a Classic!!
text: While in Boston I stopped in Cambridge to visit Harvard. Wow!! I have been to other Ivy League schools, and this was the most impressive. The old Buildings of red brick just scream history as you look at them. It's a very calm campus. It was fun to walk and see where great historic people and events took place. Spent a couple of hours and enjoyed it. Great place for pics. When in Boston-go check out Harvard. It's a great experience.

title: Very historic... a lovely campus
text:
During vacation times, campus tours are offered to visitors.  Times and information are easy to find on Harvard's website  Unfortunately we arrived a week after these finished for the summer and therefore had to make our own way around.  There is however a very good self guided audio tour and map to download from the Harvard website and I would highly recommend doing this before your visit as you will get so much more out of it.  The best tube to get to is Harvard on the red line and the university is just across the road.
Once in the campus, to be honest there is virtually nothing you can go inside of, the university only allows you to walk around outside.  As long as you keep this in mind and appreciate the exterior of the buildings and the squares you will enjoy your visit.
Some buildings not to be missed are the Memorial Hall, the Henry Widener library, the church opposite the library and the John Harvard statue. It's certainly an area to spend some time in, as the buildings are beautiful and very historic. It's a very calm atmosphere to walk around and you could easily spend an hour or 2 appreciating the history.

title: OK, but not great
text: Took the guided tour of Harvard this morning and the guided tour of MIT this afternoon.  The Harvard tour was OK but all we really saw were the dormitory buildings in Harvard Square.  These were the original classrooms back in the day.  The tour was good if you're interested in the history of Harvard, not so good if you want to know about the school today.  The MIT tour on the other hand was excellent.  They went into both the history of the school as well as the current curriculum.  Both schools are in Cambridge, two stops away from each other on the subway.  Both schools have plentry of places to eat lunch and both sell cool stuff in their book store.

title: Beautiful for the eyes
text: You need a few hours to walk around and you may have a guided tour with students. It is free but you give them a great tip! Lots of shopping to do around and a lot of restaurants also. Very easy to go to . Great site! A must see!

title: VERY INTERESTING AND MOTIVATING
text: Great visit and tour guided by one of the students. This is a free tour and you should not miss it.  The tour begins across from the University in a gallery

title: Great tour of Harvard University
text:
We took a 10:30 tour of Harvard university led by a Harvard student Eddy. Wow! It was great! Eddy was fun and interesting to listen to. He provided the group with interesting historical facts as well as some funny stories. The tour lasted 90 min and covered a lot of the campus. Unfortunately we didn't go inside any of the halls. But we thoroughly enjoyed the tour.
The tour is free of charge (surprise!) but tips are greatly encouraged. In fact, after such a wonderful tour we wanted to show our appreciation anyway.

title: Magnificent
text:
Was staying in boston and decided to take a short drive over for a view of the renowned harvard campus.

Many of the buildings/infrastructure had such a history to it as evidenced by the design, carvings, material of the building etc. Being able to take a drive through the campus was also a great experience, especially when harvard is a ground for many of the brilliant minds of this world. 

What struck me most was that Harvard had a kind of a city centre for itself and seems very much like a warm, close knitted community.

A truly remarkable experience and makes me wanna study all over again.

title: Great walking tour by the students
text:
Hi

We were visiting Boston over 5th to 8th July and took the metro to Harvard Uni thinking we would just have a quick wander around with the aid of our guidebook. As we came out of the station there were some harvard students milling around in their distinctive t shirts. Asked if we would like to join the tips only walking tour we decided to do just that. Best idea of the day! Our guide was a third year government law student who was full of enthusiasum, anecdotes, history and a blast to be with. The tour last about 1 1/2 hours and was pretty hard-paced, but you saw such a lot and learnt far more than you would from the guidebooks. Highly recommended. They suggest $10 per person and we were more than happy to hand over our $20 dollars at the end. The tour ends at the student gift shop which is run by the students and all profits are ploughed back into helping students. Prices were very reasonable - much cheaper than in Boston and I managed to get a uni hoodie for my daughter (who is off to uni in the UK soon) for about $15 dollars cheaper than I had saw in Boston. Around the gift shop there are plenty of places to eat and we had a late lunch at a great student pub, again very reasonable.

If you only have a short time to see Harvard I would definitely recommend this walking tour.

title: Harvard U-must see!
text: We toured Harvard University in Cambridge with a university student for FREE! The tour lasts about an hour and gives you great insight into Harvard's long storied past. Just sign up at the student center. Tours run throughout the day.The university is a short subway ride from downtown Boston. You can then have a bite to eat anywhere in the area-lots to chose from. It's a must see attraction.

title: A lot of history but still just a college campus...
text:
Cool to wander through the university but after a while it looks like most college campuses. 

It is a large campus so we recommed you decide what you'd like to see first then head over there.

title: Beautiful school with lots of history
text:
We took a tour led by students working for a Harvard store. They were easy to spot with their "Hahvahd" shirts and energy. They took us on a quick, lively tour of the school. We enjoyed the humor and energy of the students. 

Please note that this is not a "free" tour, but runs on tips and is basically a sales pitch for the store, which is where the tour ends; however if you just want a quick tour, this is the one to go on.

title: Be sure to visit not only the old-yard! Several other places of H great too.
text: Most tourists visit only the Harvard old-yard (around Harvard Hall and the freshman housing), either via the Hahvahd/Harvard tour or by themselves. Make sure you visit also the Memorial Hall (dining hall Freshman) at the rear entrance (front entrance only for H-students), the Harvard Museum of Natural History and one of the Harvard Art Museums. If you have time left, stroll via Adam's House / Quincy house towards the Charles River and bring a visit to the Harvard Business School campus. You are able to enter most of the buildings, for instance the Bloomberg Library with a small exhibition. Just orientate more instead of only the old-year with the squirrels.

title: High energy tour...great for tweens and teens!
text: We highly recommend the "Hahvahd" Tour guided by Harvard students.  Our girls, especially, appreciated the humor and interesting tidbits from these very enthusiastic tour guides! It's fast paced...and, at least on our tour, we didn't enter any buildings which was a disappointment for me...but just fine with my tweenage kids.  Fun trivia and some history without spending an entire day (which I would have loved as well!)

title: Tour of Harvard University - A must!
text: On our recent vacation to Boston, we wanted to have our high school aged daughter take a look at Harvard's campus. We took the subway to Harvard and fully intended to merely walk around the campus on our own. As soon as we exited the subway station we were greeted by three delightful Harvard students advertising their "Hahvahd tour". They were so humourous that we decided to go along with it. Fee is by donation only and lasts approximately 1 1/2 hours. We had a blast! I am SOOOO glad that we went on this tour. Gabrielle was our guide and she was wonderful! My father graduated from Harvard many moons ago and I thought I knew many stories. Gabrielle gave us so much of harvard's history that the general public just does not know. She presented the entire tour as a 'story teller' and really made it all come to life. (I know she said she was an "English concentrator", but she sure has a knack for public speaking!) We came home telling my father stories that not even 'he' did not know! The history behind the library is truly a great one. If you plan on going to Cambridge to see Harvard, excuse me..."Hahvahd",  you MUST take this tour. Cambridge and Harvard are beautiful areas....close to a big city...small town atmosphere....intellectual vibe....benches, parks, birds singing. Nice.

title: The Most Student Friendly City
text:
A stay in Boston is incomplete without a visit to Harvard University, Freedom Trail, Prudential Towers and the Harvard Museum of Natural History.

My visit to Harvard University turned out to be very different in a decidedly intellectual way. The first stop was the Harvard Business School. To walk in the corridors of the world’s Best Business School is a totally awe inspiring experience that takes you back in time. 

Within the Harvard campus, I stumbled upon a stone edict dating back to 1636!

Next, I hopped across Charles over the Pedestrian Bridge from HBS into Cambridge which led me to Harvard Square. 

Harvard Square is an ideal weekend getaway for students from both Harvard and MIT. And if you get hungry due to the walk, what could be more irresistible than a hot bowl of soup with rich Indian spices at the Bombay Club that I found cuddled in a corner of JFK Street.

title: Wandering the Unviersity Campus
text: Wandering around the Cambridge campus of Harvard is a pleasant way to get from one end of Cambridge to another.  The architecture is impressive (although now an amalgam of old and new buildings and styles), and on a good day, sitting on the lawn in front of the Widener Library playing with the squirrels is a stress reducing activity.  It's one of the top universities in the world, and does have that traditional 'sandstone' feel about it.  Because it is a university populated by students though, you might also see some odd sights, as we did the day we were there in January. The sun was out, and the sky was blue, and there was a group of three women in bikinis on the lawn.  Mind you, the temperature was about 3 degrees celsius at the time, so I'm not sure if they were on a dare, and I am sure they wouldn't have stayed there for very long!   Because the campus is so spread out, it's probably not a typical 'tourist' destination, but I would recommend wandering through the campus instead of walking around it if you get the chance.

title: Schönes Universitätsgelände
text:
Sehr schönes Universitätsgelände mit dem Spirit einer Top-Universtität. Harvard gehört zur sog. Ivy League (= 8 Eliteuniversiäten in den USA), denn die Alumni dieser Universität erhielten mit inzwischen > 160 Nobelpreise, mehr Auszeichnungen als Abgänger anderer Hochschulen.

Leider mit dem Auto als "Tourist" schlecht erreichbar, da sehr ungünstige Parkplatzsituation um das gesamte Gelände - d.h. lieber etwas weiter wegparken und zu Fuß hingehen.

title: interessante
text: O campus da faculdade é lindo, ficamos deslumbrados com o lugar, passamos meio dia visitando a universidade, gostamos muito, eu recomendo

title: Excelente experiencia conociendo Harvard
text: Visita guiada a pie en Harvard . Fundamental para entender cómo funciona cada espacio, dónde comen y viven los estudiantes .

title: 紅葉がとても素敵なキャンパス
text:
11月中旬のキャンパス内は、既に紅葉が始まっており、とても綺麗です。
車移動も便利ですが、ハーバード駅まで地下で行くのが便利かと思います。地下鉄は、通勤時間帯を外れるとガラガラです。
写真のように、芝の緑に木々の赤や黄色の紅葉が映えて、大理石やレンガ造りの建物とマッチしてとても素敵でした。
キャンパス内にはリスも居て、時々姿を見せて楽しませてくれます。
休日や遅い時間は、ゲートでIDの提示が求められますので、ご注意下さい。

title: Très intéressant
text: Juste promener dans le campus est un expérience en soi. L'architecture des bâtiments historiques est vraiment superbe. Le campus était quasiment vide car nous y sommes allés en Juillet. Cela doit être impressionnant de le visiter en période universitaire.

title: un giro nella prestigiosa harvard
text: il campus è molto grande, tuttavia non so se mi sia perso qualcosa, ma di fatto non si può entrare nella stragrande maggioranza degli edifici (come visitatori, quindi non studenti o affiliati); si nota comunque la grande internazionalità, con studenti, famiglie e visitatori da ogni parte del mondo; del resto è una delle università migliori del mondo e non potrebbe essere altrimenti, oltre che la più antica degli stati uniti; ho visitato il museo di storia naturale di cui scriverò una recensione a parte; l'università è a cambridge che è una città teoricamente separata da boston, anche se il campus è facilmente raggiungibile impiegando circa 20 minuti di metro rossa dal boston common; diciamo che merita un giro più per il nome che per altro

title: Emouvant
text: Quelle classe. On y revoit des films. On pense à Harry Widener noyé dans le Titanic, tristesse en voyant la bibliothèque qui porte son nom. Bibliothèque figée dans le temps; elle ne peut pas s’agrandir. C’est le deal.

title: Inimitable
text:
Une université à l'ancienne.
Harry Potter y serait parfaitement à l'aise.
Superbes bâtiments de briques.
Il y en a un fait par Le Corbusier, mais ça détonne vraiment dans le décor.
Il y a un document de visite en français pour 3 dollars à l'accueil (en dehors de l'université, de l'autre côté de la rue).

title: come nei film
text: ci siam fermati qui mentre stavamo andando a Boston e passeggiare anche solo per i giardini di questa iconica università ne è valsa la pena.

title: unbedingt
text: sehr schönes altes Gelände. also ich habe das Wissen dort nicht gespürt, aber ich fand es sehr imposant. Es ist ohne Kosten zugänglich und es ist ein Muss die Uni zu besuchen, wenn man in Boston ist

title: Una delusione
text: Mi aspettavo molto di più. L’atmosfera dell’università è molto carina ma non è possibile accedere a nessun sito salvo la chiesa. Una vera delusione non ci tornerei

title: Belo passeio
text: O campus é muito bonito. Vale muito a pena a visita. Próximo está Harvard Square e mais uns 30 minutos de caminhada você está no MIT.

title: Una visita inolvidable
text: Cuantos hemos hablado y opinado de Harvard, pero jamás hemos visto como se convive en una de las cunas del conocimiento?  Realmente vale la pena visitarlo en Boston

title: Hermoso recorrido
text: En 2015 habíamos estado visitando los jardines. Ahora en verano, esa inmensidad para el descanso y el estudio, presidido por el monumento a su fundador

title: Polecam
text: Jeden z amerykańskich kampusów (ten najsłynniejszy). Ładna architektura, wszystko pięknie utrzymane. Widać, że to bardzo bogata ulczenia.

title: Lugar de ida obrigatória
text: A Universidade de Harvard parece uma cidade pois o campus tem uma infraestrutura muito grande e diversificada em restaurantes, farmácias entre outros. Os prédios refletem a beleza e harmonia em um ambiente bucólico. Lembra as Universidades Inglesas.

title: Görmek güzeldi...
text: İsmini sıklıkla duyduğumuz İçin, benim için merak uyandıran bir üniversite kampüsüydü. Sırf burayı görmek için, Boston turuna katıldık. J. Harvard heykelinin pabucuna dokunmak, ziyarete gelen öğrenciler ve veliler için bir ritüel haline gelmiş. Eğitim hayatında şans getireceğine inanılıyor. Tarihi binaları var. Güzel bir yerleşke.

title: Fascinante
text: Al recorrer el campus se sumerge en sus historias y anécdotas, cada uno de sus edificios esta lleno de historias, los alojamientos de Bill gates, mark zuckerberg, entre otros, realmente fascinante

title: No 1 πανεπιστήμιο
text: Ιδρύθηκε το 1636 και είναι το παλιότερο πανεπιστήμιο στις Ηνωμένες Πολιτείες. Ανάμεσα στους σημαντικότερους αποφοίτους της είναι και εφτά πρόεδροι της ΗΠΑ. Μπορείτε να χαζεψετε την πανεπιστημιούπολη ανάμεσα στα δέντρα και στα δύο κεντρικά κτίρια που είναι η memorial εκκλησία και η βιβλιοθήκη Widener απο όπου μπορείτε να τραβήξετε καταπληκτικές πανοραμικές φωτογραφίες του πανεπιστημίου.

title: Гарвардский университет
text: Зачем российскому туристу необходимо приехать в Кембридж – пригород Бостона, небольшой городок на другом берегу реки Чарльз? Во первых, чтобы узнать, а кому-то вспомнить, что американский Кембридж – это другой, не английский Кембридж, и от этого немного разочароваться… Поэтому фраза «бывали мы и в Кембридже», на образованных и подготовленных слушателей особого впечатления не произведет, особенно после уточнения, в каком именно Кембридже вы бывали. Однако у вас будет в запасе ход с козыря, когда вы скажете, что в Кембридж вы поехали, чтобы увидеть Гарвард! Вот это – другое дело! Элитный университет – основная достопримечательность Кембриджа. Осмотрев несколько исторических кирпичных зданий университета, включая Гарвард Холл, Офис Президента, а также университетскую мемориальную церковь, вы сможете говорить «Ну, сами мы Гарвардов не кончали, но все же бывали в Кембридже и видели, как там все устроено…». На самом деле с экскурсией вы увидите снаружи очень малую часть этого гигантского элитного университета, входящего в «Лигу плюща», располагающего более чем двумя тысячами преподавателей и семью тысячами студентов. Среди его выпускников наибольшее в США количество миллиардеров.  Сейчас здесь семь факультетов, которые мы назвали бы гуманитарными. Точные и технические науки на соответствующих факультетах изучают в находящемся здесь же в Кембридже знаменитом Массачусетском технологическом институте.

title: Erfolgsschmiede...
text:
Unzählbare Persönlichkeiten entwickelten sich auf dieser Uni. Es gibt auch vermutlich niemanden, der den Namen dieser Universität nicht in irgendeinem Zusammenhang schon mal gehört hat. Dementsprechend ein MUSS für jeden Boston-Urlauber. 
Jetzt wird jeder, der bereits (mit kleinen Ausnahmen) deutsche Unis kennt, sagen: Was soll denn da schön sein? Aber die Antwort ist recht einfach: ALLES!
Ob wunderschöne nostalgische Gebäude, die sauberen und strahlenden Grünflächen oder die gesamte Historie, die sich hinter dieser Uni versteckt... Hier hätte auch ich vermutlich jeden Vorlesungstag mit Freude entgegengefiebert.

title: El campus puede resultar un poco frío, se respira el aire elitista
text:
Visité Harvard durante mi visita a Boston. Es muy fácil llegar al campus en Metro.
Mi conclusión fue un poco decepcionante. No es factible ingresar a la enorme Biblioteca que tiene la entidad, ni a prácticamente ninguno de los edificios.
No es un lugar muy amigable, los estudiantes están en su propio clima y no registran a los visitantes.
He estado en otros campus mucho más amigables (ej Trinity College en Dublin, los College en Oxford), no repetiría ni aconsejaría la visita.

title: Wissen ist spürbar
text: Da dies eine der besten Universitäten weltweit ist und schon sehr viele bekannte Persönlichkeiten hier studiert haben, sollte man unbedingt vorbei schauen. Von überall zugänglich, kostenfrei und auch gut mit den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln zu erreichen.

title: Mythique
text:
Un endroit mythique même s'il n'y a pas grand chose à voir ! Juste y être et s'y promener !
L'église, la grande bibliothèque néo-classique, le hall de la faculté de science plus sans compter la statue de M.Harvard dont il faut toucher le pied pour la réussite des examens...
L'entrée des bâtiments est la plupart du temps interdite aux visiteurs.

title: Qué bueno!!!!
text: Participamos con mi mujer del momento en que los nuevos estudiantes van a ocupar sus habitaciones para el ciclo lectivo 2019/2020, qué momento, qué emoción. Las familias llevando todo lo que sus hijos van a usar o necesitar... Estudiantes de niveles superiores recibiéndolos, con refrescos, recomendaciones, etc. Qué organización, que bienvenida!!!! Inolvidable...

title: Lugar incrível
text: A instituição por si só já dispensa avaliações, mas, não tem como não citar a arquitetura e a organização de todo o complexo, que é simplesmente espetacular.

title: Campus bajo la lluvia
text: Visitamos las instalaciones de la Universidad de Harvard bajo la lluvia pero de todas maneras pudimos admirar sus edificios, la famosa estatua de John Harvard e imaginarnos en las tantas películas filmadas allí.

title: ボストンの学会の合間に
text: ボストンでの学会の合間にハーバード大学に行きました。キャンパスはとても大きくて緑豊かで綺麗でした。近くには生協もありハーバード関連グッズがたくさんありました。グッツは子供用から大人まで何でも揃ってました。

title: Cenário de vários filmes
text: O campus é cenário de vários filmes, lindeza de tirar o fôlego finalizada por esquilos subindo e descendo das árvores, para “brasileiro nenhum botar defeito “!

title: Increíble el campus y la vida que tiene el lugar
text: Podés ir hasta Harvard sin problemas, no hay mucho lugar para estacionar adentro, asi que dejaria el auto un poco mas lejos y caminar. Hay 2 partes, la de postgrados que es lindo, pero nos gustó mucho más el campus de grado, con parque, un pequeño puente, mucho mas vida. Fuimos un sábado por lo que habia mucha gente haciendo deporte y visitando, muy recomendable.

title: Fonte do Saber
text: Caminhar pelos jardins de Harvard é inspirador. Esse lugar com quase 400 anos de ensino e por onde diversos líderes mundiais já passaram, é uma visita imperdível para quem visita Cambridge.

title: Viaggio USA settembre 19
text: Ho visitato il campus dell'Harvard University è  stata una esperienza bellissima vedere quanti studenti da tutto il mondo sono presenti. Se avete tempo ne vale veramente la pena consigliatissima. Anche al MIT veramente fantastico.

title: Nova escola
text: Fomos conhecer a universidade de Harvard. Os jardins são bem amplos, tem diversos prédios. Como estávamos na época de natal o clima não estava dos melhores e os granados estavam com um pouco de neve. No verão a paisagem deve ser muito mais bonita!

title: Impressionnant
text: Nous y sommes allés sans grande conviction mais avons été charmés par les bâtiments majestueux et l'immensité du campus. À faire par beau temps car on ne peut entrer dans les bâtiments.

title: Leuke buurt en mooie campus
text: Gelegen in cambridge ligt de harvard campus. Je kan er niet veel doen maar het is mooi om te zien. Je kan via de app je eigen tour doen en ondanks dat je niet echt ergens in mag zijn veel gebouwen en lokalen open. Loop ook even naar het business gedeelte aan de andere kant van de rivier. Bij grendels denn kan je goedkoop en lekker eten en drinken bij happy hour

title: Harward
text: En anrik och spännande miljö som var både kul och intressant att besöka. Vädret bjöd dock på - 12 grader och blåst vilket vilket bidrog till att vi ska åka tillbaka hit under varmare årstider. Vi fick muta barnen med DD.

title: Recorrido Historico
text: Dar un paseo por el recorrido histórico de Harvard es hermoso. El campus hermoso, lleno de historia y todo el mundo super amable. Fuimos sin tour y la verdad igual lo disfrutamos.

title: Universidad histórica
text: Harvard University... una de las mejores y más famosas universidades del mundo mundial... la mas antigua de USA. Centro cultural, educacional e histórico... un paseo de varias horas. Puedes tomar un tour guiado por alumnos. Se llega fácilmente en metro, linea roja .... o caminando desde Boston, cruzando algún puente sobre el Charles River. Un imperdible para gente educada...

title: Un buen paseo por la academia
text: Es fácil llegar desde Boston. Se puede acceder solo al campus (a los edificios solo con credencial, excepto a la iglesia). Un paseo para 20 minutos

title: Majestosa
text:
No centro de Cambridge, Harvard é um sonho.
É possível adquirir um city tour nas proximidades e vale muito a pena. A biblioteca é fantastica!

title: Familia
text: Passeio obrigatória desde sempre. Para todos os gostos. Para entender melhor contrate um aluno e aproveite melhor. O museu é único e de graça.

title: CUNA DE MENTES BRILLANTES!!
text: La gran Universidad de USA y del mundo, cuna de grandes cientificos, economistas, y mentes brillantes del universo. Visitar todo el campus, con los distintos edificios tanto los habitaciones como los que contienen las aulas es muy grato. Me impresiono ver la primer computadora que existió, una mole de IBM del tamaño de una habitación. Como será el orden que existe que hasta una policia propia tienen.

title: Le coeur des universités mondiales
text: Dans un campus assez resserré, de nombreux endroits remarquables comme l'église (non confessionnelle), la grande bibliothèque néo-classique, le hall de la faculté de science avec le plus ancien ordinateur IBM... sans compter la statue de Harvard dont il faut aller toucher le pied pour réussir ses examens...

title: Deludente
text:
Passare per Boston e non andare ad Harward è praticamente impossibile.
Quando ci si arriva, però, soprattutto se si è già visitata Georgetown a Washington DC o le britanniche Oxford e Cambridge, è altrettanto impossibile non rimanere delusi.
Da visitare con il sole, ha ampi prati, tra un edificio e l'altro, ma nessuno di essi è architettonicamente rilevante.
La sua fama è superiore alla sua forma.

title: una visita muy buena para incorporar
text: Nos atendieron de primera, nos hicieron un tour dentro de la universidad y nos explicaron todo, luego visitamos las aulas y todos los lugares del predio

title: Incontournable mais décevant
text: Rien de spécial à voir une fois sur place, juste y être. Des travaux gâchent un peu la vue. Un petit tour, quelques clichés sur les marches de la bibliothèque et puis s'en va. Même les 2 boutiques de souvenirs trouvées aux abords sont peu engageantes.

title: Un istituzione
text: Una volta arrivato a Boston credo sia impossibile non visitare Harvard, l'università più famosa ed importante nel mondo. La visita può essere effettuata da soli o accompagnati da matricole al prezzo di 10$ circa. Noi abbiamo effettuato la visita con uno studente molto simpatico, capace di intrattenervi per tutto il tempo a patto che capiate molto bene l'inglese in quanto gli Americani parlano molto veloce ed a Boston mangiano un po' le parole. La visita è stata molto piacevole, l'atmosfera all'interno del campus è incredibile. Se dovessi valutare solamente il luogo darei sicuramente il massimo del punteggio ma ci sono state delle cose che non sono piaciute: partendo dal fatto che siamo nell'università più prestigiosa del mondo e che gli studenti, anche quelli '' meno facoltosi''' provengono da classi molto agiate della società, trovo assurdo il continuo far riferimento al gift shop e alle mance da dover lasciare agli studenti che vi accompagnano.

title: Un mito!
text: Un mito sicuramente! Come turista, pero,, ben lontana dal fascino di altre universita' europee come Oxford o Cambridge

title: Imprescindible visita en Boston
text: Merece la pena ir a Harvard solo por tantas películas que hemos visto al respecto. Es un paseo agradable y llegar en metro desde Boston es muy fácil. El ambiente por la noche en los alrededores también es digno de ver.

title: Que lugar!!
text: Assim como toda a região, dentro dos portões da universidade o passeio nos trás uma vontade enorme de observar a dinâmica dos alunos no entra e sai dos prédios, nas leituras nas cadeiras espalhadas pelo gramado, nos alojamentos que são minúsculos e nos muitos turistas fazendo fotos. Muito agradável conhecer um pouquinho desse mundo dos feras... e tem muito mais... tour guiado por um aluno, biblioteca e mesmo o caminhar sozinho e descobrir cada lugarzinho.

title: Sensaciones
text: Estuvimos el fin de semana de inicio de curso, donde se veian los padres ayudando con los carritos a sus hijos que se instalaban en pisos de la Universidad. En el campus se respiraba un ambiente especial, donde se mezclavan los nuevos estudiantes con los mas veteramos.

title: 歴史あるキャンパス
text:
Red Lineで行って来ました。Harverd Squareで降りると（後方の改札口）すぐそこが街の中心Harverd Squareです。
手前のHarverd Yardは観光客が入れるエリア。ここだけでもHarverdの雰囲気が十分に味わえます。緑の中に余裕を持って建つ特徴的な建物。いかにも歴史のある大学！
ツアーへの参加という手もありますが、勝手に入って、勝手に見学するのが良いと思います。
一部しか見てないけど、思ったよりは小さかったかなぁ？

title: Splendido parco
text: Il campus universitario è una tappa obbligatoria! Le sedie colorate nel parco sono a disposizione dei visitatori e spesso ci sono anche artisti che suonano.

title: 아이들한테 여행의 즐거움과 함께 동기부여도..
text: 보스턴 공항으로 입국해서 제일 처음으로 들린 곳이 대학교.. 하버드 동상의 발을 만지면서 사진을 찍기까지 시간이 좀 걸립니다. 역시 아시아계의 자녀교육열은 대단하다 싶어요. 오래된 건물들이 서부에서는 보지 못했던 분위기를 자아냅니다. 사진 배경이 아주 멋지게 나옵니다.

title: Visite Harvard avec Boston le nez en l’air
text: Il serait dommage de ne pas  visiter le campus de Harvard lorsque l’on visite Boston. Le faire avec Valentine a été indispensable car les bâtiments ne se visitent pas donc sans explications l’intérêt est moindre. Valentine est une guide sympathique et qui nous a bien renseigné sur les études aux USA et sur les conditions d’entrée dans cette prestigieuse université.

title: Quanto avrei voluto studiare lì
text:
Un complesso di edifici, alcuni dei quali di grande profilo storico, si susseguono in questo che sembra un paesino di altri tempi con una dimensione a sé rispetto al resto della città. Mentre attraversavo il campus il mio pensiero ricorrente era che mi sarebbe piaciuto tanto poter studiare lì. Poter entrare nella grande biblioteca del campus , il cui ingresso è permesso solo agli studenti o comunque al personale universitario, e perdermi in quelle enormi stanze.
Consiglio una visita, anche in solitaria, non è necessaria la guida.

title: icono
text: vale la pena visitarla ya que ademas de ser un icono mundial es un parque y unas construcciones muy lindas. comodo de llegar

title: Valió la pena visitarla
text: Llegamos al "campus" y coincidía con la bienvenida a los alumnos que comenzaban este ciclo. Ver a los padres y alumnos completar lo necesario para sus habitaciones, desde ventiladores hasta almohadas, fue muy emotivo. Ver a los alumnos de años superiores recibir a los nuevos estudiantes con refrescos, donnats, agua, jugos y demás fue muy impactante. Es una excelente Universidad.

title: Lindos Edifícios e entorno
text: Universidade Histórica com belíssimos edifícios que só podem entrar os estudantes com credenciais. Entorno realmente interessante, com mais edifícios históricos, boas cafeterias e livrarias. Para quem tem interesse em conhecer, a primeira semana de Setembro tem várias formaturas e diversos alunos ingressando. Várias festas e comemorações na praça.

title: Storia
text: Sicuramente una delle più famose università del mondo, se si passa da Boston non può mancare una passeggiata all'interno del campus. Un po' fuori dal centro ma con la fermata della metro proprio davanti all'ingresso principale

title: Sadeliğin verdiği güzellikle dolu kampüs
text: John Harvard heykeline dokunarak fotograf çektirmek için sıraya giren öğrenci adayları,kampüste gezen sincaplar,huzur dolu sükünet ve ağaçlar inanılmaz bir armoni

title: Sentore di eccellenza
text: La storia passa da qui, si ferma nei cortili, nelle aule, nei laboratori e sfiora il piede della statua di bronzo del fondatore.

title: à voir, mais sans y passer trop de temps
text: Faut pas s'attendre à voir grands choses, juste sentir et imaginer l'histoire. Ce n'est pas non plus très beau, ce n'est pas non plus hors du commun. Mais, comment aller à Boston sans faire un petit crochet à Cambridge et Harvard ? Personnellement, j'y suis resté moins d'une heure. Au petit matin, c'était assez agréable.

title: Visita ad Harvard bella esperienza
text:
Abbiamo visitato Harvard con la mia famiglia.
E possibile parcheggiare in prossimità dell’ingresso, e si può visitare tranquillamente da soli, a patto che ci si sia documentati. Si percepisce che è un istituzione molto antica e importante per gli USA. In prossimità ci sono anche molti negozi che vendono tutte le divise  dell’universita’.
C’erano anche parecchi studenti e tutto sembra organizzato per loro

title: Super
text: Très très beau campus, avec toute son histoire. Je recommande d’avoir un guide ou bien au moins des explications sous la main.

title: Auténtica
text:
Campus universitario muy acogedor localizado al lado de Boston. Visita interesante en la que te haces una idea de
 Como es la vida en el campus

title: No pueden dejar de visitarla
text: Cuna de la cultura, la educación y la historia . La universidad de Harvard se encuentra en Cambridge, cruzando un puente desde Boston . Son solo 4 kilómetros de caminata , o en Metro a través de la línea Roja. Edificio únicos, jardines espectaculares. La visita en verano está llena de belleza. Ver donde se estudia, conocer la historia de esta Universidad que es la más antigua de Estados Unidos. También todo el barrio cercano a la universidad vale la pena. Hay casas impresionante, los campus y las fraternidades .

title: Muita Bom
text: Lugar histórico de Boston, muitos mitos e curiosidades envolvidas nesse local ... Impossível ir a Boston e não visitar a Harvard

title: Visite du quadrilatère Harvard
text: Quel beau quartier! Je n’ai pas eu la chance de visiter l’intérieur des bâtiments cependant le site est génial à visiter

title: Emozionate
text: Davvero emozionante entrare! Consiglio davvero chi è a Boston di fare una tappa per vedere l’università! Potrete attraversare il parco e girare tranquillamente all’interno del campus! Ve lo consiglio

title: Harvard guided tour
text: Je n’avais pas de grandes attentes car je n’ai jamais rêvé d’y aller mais j’ai trouvé dommage de payer un tour guidé pour uniquement voir l’extérieur des buildings. Certes nous avons eu le droit à plusieurs anecdotes et informations mais a aucun moment nous n’avons pu voir le plus interessant; il fallait regarder le réfectoire à travers un hublot, impossible de visiter la librairie et bien sûr pas de visites d’au moins une chambre étudiant témoin. Donc personnellement je n’ai pas vu l’intérêt de cette visite, heureusement que la guide était sympa!

title: Se respira un ambiente especial. Visita a no perderse
text:
Es muy recomendable perderse por todo su entorno. 
Repetiria sin pensarlo pero cogiendo algun tour disponible con los propios alumnos de Harvard para conocer la historia porque por tu cuenta no le sacas ni mucho menos el mismo provecho y por mucho que consultes por internet te pierdes cosas y el lugar tiene la suficiente historia para compartir.

title: A faire et à voir....
text: Nous l'avons fait sans guide...mais ça donne déjà une belle impression et émotion que de se retrouver là. On peut déambuler au milieu des bâtiments historiques. Le magasin de la Coop des étudiants est beau et intéressant à voir aussi. Je vous conseille de faire la visite guidée par un étudiant bénévole ...c'est quand même mieux c'est souvent en anglais toutefois...quelques départs en Français paraît-il ...

title: Très belle université
text: Centre ville, des transports, des logements, des espaces verts, des bâtiments magnifiques ! Pourquoi n'a-t-on pas "les mêmes à la maison " ?!

title: pour tous les âges
text: Une activité vraiment pour les gens de tous âges . Il y a les trois mensonges qui est une erreur de construction de la statue de john arvord. La statue dit que john arvard a fondé l'université Harvard en 1638 mais ce n'est pas lui sur la statue , ce n'est pas lui qui a fondé l'université Harvard et cette dernière a été fondé en 1636. Il y a une légende qui dit que si tu touches au soulier de john avord  tu va réussir toute ton année scolaire.

title: Emozionante
text: Se andate a Boston, con i mezzi è possibile raggiungere in pochi minuti Cambridge dove potrete visitare l’università  Di Harvard, che sentiamo sempre nelle commedie americane! Li è possibile fare un giro tra i giardini universitari, vedere studenti con la divisa del college, e vi sembrerà proprio di stare in un film!

title: 청소년 동반 여행이라면...
text: 보스턴에선 하버드를 꼭 한번 들르겠지요? 더운데 하버드대학교를 방문하고 하버드 동상의 발도 살포시 만지고 왔습니다. 잘 모르지만 그냥 이곳저곳 다니는 재미도 있어서 좋았습니다. 투어하는 사람이 정말 많아서 놀라기는 했습니다.

title: Mycket intressant
text: En fantastisk upplevelse att vandra runt på dessa klassiska marker. Området är mycket öppet och tillängligt.

title: Старейший из Университетов США
text: Всегда мечтала посетить знаменитые университеты,которые входят в Лигу Плюща. Слов нет. Это восторг!!!

title: A voir : 1h est largement suffisant
text:
Facilement accessible depuis Boston en métro. 
Vous vous promenez dans le parc. Si vous prenez un guide, il y en a en français cela permet d’avoir des petits histoires de cette université. L’ambiance est bonne. Et il est agréable de s y poser. 
Pour moi ce n’est pas un incontournable à boston. Mais c’est mythique . 
Freedom trail est le numéro un à faire 
Puis les parcs dans boston
Et La librairie public

title: Laissez-vous guider...
text: Nous avons fait une visite guidée gratuite très intéressante du campus. Notre guide nous a raconté des anecdotes très intéressantes. Je recommande définitivement cette visite. Dommage que nous ne puissions entrer dans aucun bâtiment...

title: Visita al campus
text: Tour di circa 1.15h con uno studente che spiega com'è strutturato il campus e alcuni accenni storici.

title: Tour a Boston, visita a Harvard
text: Precioso lugar, muy interesante la historia de la universidad de Harvard, la estatua del fundador que le llaman la estatua de las 3 mentiras. El campus es hermoso, la vegetación, lo único que no nos favoreció fueron las altas temperaturas de esta época, 37 grados centígrados

title: Muy linda
text: Cometimos el error de ir por nuestra cuenta, y nos pareció muy lindo todo, pero eran edificios únicamente. Lo ideal es una visita guiada, donde te cuentan qué es cada edificio y algunos detalles más, ya que sino no tiene mucho sentido.

title: ΝΟΙΩΘΕΙΣ ΔΕΟΣ!!!
text: Αξίζει μία επίσκεψη σε ένα από τα καλύτερα πανεπιστήμια του κόσμου. Αριστα διατηρημένο μέσα σε πανέμορφο κήπο.Καμία σχέση με τα Ελληνικά Πανεπιστήμια  που  σε πονάει να τα βλέπεις . Παντού βλέπεις επηρεασμό από ΕΛΛΑΔΑ -αρχιτεκτονική, επιγραφές, κίονεσ κλπ-

title: Visita obligada, lindo campus.....
text:
Si uno está en Boston se hace una visita obligada llegarse a la Universidad de Harvard para recorrer su campus que es muy bonito con sus edificios vistos tantas veces en películas o a través de programas de televisión.
El ambiente es muy acogedor y muy agradable el paseo por sus distintos edificios.

title: Eliteuniversität
text: Eine sehr interessante Uni mit toller Bibliothek, die zu den größten der Erde gehört! Das Gelände ist wunderschön mit Grünflächen und Bäumen angelegt. Mittels guter Busverbindung kommt man mühelos hierher. Der Eintritt auf das Gelände ist von verschiedenen Seiten möglich und ist frei! Wenn man in Boston weilt, sollte man sich einen Besuch hier nicht entgehen lassen.

title: Χάρβαρντ
text: Γνωστό σε όλους μας αυτό το Πανεπιστήμιο, είχα μια περιέργεια να το δω από κοντά πως είναι, καθώς περπατούσα και συμβουλευοβουν τον χάρτη δεν θα το καταλάβαινα ότι ήταν αυτό το κτίριο αν δεν αναγραφόταν στον χάρτη, πέρασα επίσης από την πανεπιστημιούπολη,τίποτα το ιδιαίτερο. Δεν ξέρω τι περίμενα, ίσως είναι επειδή είναι πασίγνωστο και περιμένεις κάτι extraordinary.

title: Flotte bygninger
text: Besøkte Harvard for å se campus. Flotte bygninger og mye historie. Da vi besøkte stedet var det starten på sommerskole, med mye aktivitet.

title: Visita turística obligada
text:
Harvard es sinónimo de universidad americana para el visitante extranjero.

La visita y la foto tocando el pie del supuesto Sr. Harvard son obligadas.

title: Vale la pena!!
text:
El sitio Cambridge vale la pena y la Universidad de Harvard también
Estuve dando una buena vuelta al campus y lo recomiendo ampliamente

title: Intéressant
text:
Même si on ne peut pas pénétrer dans les bâtiments, une balade à travers le Harvard Yard permet de se faire une idée de la puissance et de l’influence de cette université. Les plus vieux bâtiments ont 300 ans et ont abrité les troupes de George Washington, mais on peut aussi admirer la seule Œuvre de Le Corbusier en Amérique du Nord (le Carpenter Center for Visual Arts) ou la belle extension du Harvard Muséum of Arts que l’on doit à Renzo Piano.
Plus de 100 nationalités sont représentées sur le campus qui a abrité plus de 60 prix Nobel.
La qualité des équipements, la richesse du patrimoine, la diversité des disciplines enseignées et des laboratoires démontrent la supériorité du système étasunien de recherche et d’enseignement supérieur.
De même, la visite de la Coop, le magasin de produits dérivés géré par les étudiants, est assez édifiante.

title: Bello campus
text:
El lugar tiene jardines y edificios bien cuidados, en esta época son las graduaciones por lo que se puede apreciar el montaje de tarimas, toldos y sillas para las ceremonias.
Es emblemático.

title: Entrada grátis
text: Tem entrada grátis para ver os prédios por fora. Com circulação para tirar foto no monumento de John Harvard. Poderá tirar fotos livremente, terá muitas pessoas fazendo a mesma coisa. Não é muito fácil de encontrar um bom letreiro com a nominação na sua foto, mas você vai encontrar

title: Imperdível
text: Local aonde flui conhecimento, vale a pena ir com alguém que conhece ou estuda lá para aproveitar o tempo e conhecer tudo. Existem lojas de souvenir com preços muito altos. Um lugar que não pode deixar de ir.

title: Harvard University
text: Universidade de Harvard localizada do estado de Massachussets , uma das mais importantes do mundo , fundada em 8 de setembro de 1636. Possui um campus lindo arborizado !!!

title: Une expérience en soi!
text: Il faut prendre le temps pour se render sur le campus de Harvard. L'endroit est surprenant. Allez voir la statue de John Harvard et apprenez=en un peu plus sur les trois mensonges à son sujet et au sujet de sa statue. Très intéressant. On est allé en metro. C'est facile de s'y rendre.

title: Interesante
text:
Recomendamos contratar algún estudiante que os hará de guia por toda la universidad.
Se instalan al lado de la oficina de turismo

title: Tienes q hacerlo
text: Muy buen recorrido pero no vayas solo, necesitas a alguien q conozca la historia . Que te lleve a todas las partes importantes,no dejes de ir a book store de Harvard pasando la calle. Todo es muy interesante y el campus es muy bonito y alberga mucho conocimiento.

title: Se respira conocimiento
text: Definitivamente este lugar se ha ganado su fama bastante bien. Cada rincón resulta sorprendente y deja descubrir muchas cosas que creías saber y otras que tienes que aprender. Museos, edificios, salones bibliotecas y espacios culturales por todos lados y cada uno con su propia historia. Cuantas personas famosas han pasado por aquí, pero sólo algunas han logrado romper los moldes y trascender. Imperdible

title: Imperdible si visitas Boston/cambridge
text: Fue una experiencia increíble estar en el campus de Harvard. Estuvimos recorriendo los edificios de ciencia y para mi que soy abogado fue muy bueno ir a la harvard law school. Muy recomendable!

title: Beroemde (oudste) universiteit van de US
text: Beroemde (oudste) universiteit van de US ca 10 km ten Noordwesten van het  centrum van Boston. In het Harvard Information Centre kan je boeken voor een 1 uur rondtoer die vele keren per dag vertrekt. Dat brengt je langs alle hoogtepunten van dit Centre of science

title: Visita obligada
text: El lugar tiene muchos espacios verdes y las clásicas casas dé los estudiantes que resulta muy pintoresco pará sacarse fotos en la fachada. A las aulas fuera de la hora de clase y sábados y domingos se puede entrar sin problemas. Se puede tambien realizar una visita guiada a cargo de estudiantes. Sí bien me gustó me la imaginaba más grande.

title: Para perderse
text: Ideal recorrido para dejarse llevar y simplemente entrar a cada edificio para sentirse un estudiante mas. Aprovechando sus espacios verdes al maximo.

title: Imperdível !
text: Um dos berços acadêmicos americanos e uma das mais famosas universidades do mundo. Vale a pena conhecer o campus - lindo, histórico e cênico!

title: Otro Imperdible de Boston
text: Cómo no ir a conocer una de las universidades más importantes del mundo si podés hacerlo?. Si bien lo podés hacer por tu cuenta, es recomensable ir con un guía. Nosotros lo hicimos con Boston By Foot. Lo hicimos un mañana con -9° C en diciembre del 2017. Es un imperdible de esta hermosa ciudad.

title: 즐거운 구경
text: 세계 최고의 대학이라고 해서 공부만 하는 학생들만 있을 줄 알았는데 자유분방한 분위기에서 각자 할 일을 열심히 하는 모습을 보면서 명문대 타이틀이 괜히 붙여진건 아니구나 싶었음

title: La institución académica más antigua de Estados Unidos
text:
Harvard es la institución académica más antigua de Estados Unidos y una de las universidades más prestigiosas del mundo, fundada en 1636  por la Corte General  de Massachusetts con el nombre de New College o The College at New Town. En 1639 se le cambio el nombre a Harvard College en recuerdo a  su primer benefactor John Harvard. 
Esta institución académica privada, en la actualidad está organizada en once unidades separadas - tres facultades y el Instituto Radcliffe para Estudios Avanzados- con campus en todo el área metropolitana de Boston aunque su campus principal se centra en el Harvard Yard en Cambridge

title: Dispersiva
text: É vero che non é propriamente un’attrazione turistica ma è pur vero che essendo una delle università più famose del mondo è visitata ogni giorno da turisti, qualche indicazione ci dovrebbe essere ... abbiamo girato un po’ per i vialetti, assistito alla cerimonia di iniziò anno e siamo andati via....

title: Un campus maravilloso
text: Es una de las mejores universidades del mundo y cada edificio lo demuestra. Hermoso, dan ganas de quedarse y estudiar ahí. Además, los alrededores en Cambridge son muy lindos, las construcciones no parecen las típicas del resto de Estados Unidos.

title: Um templo do ensino
text: Como ex-aluno sou fã e sempre que viajo à Boston dedico um tempo a revisitar a universidade, campus e fazer uma refeição no Harvard Square.

title: Indrukwekkend
text: We hadden meer een campus idee voor ogen toen we op zoek gingen naar deze bekende universiteit. Dat was het wel en ook weer niet, er is gebied wat omgeven door een muur, het oudere gedeelte en voor het overige heel veel gebouwen door dit gedeelte van de stad heen. Leuk om te mogen ervaren.

title: beau site
text:
Créée en 1636,  c'est la plus vieille université d'Amérique du Nord et une des plus prestigieuse. 

Il ya de belles façades de briques rouges anciennes pour les divers bâtiments et certains sont plus récents mais cela fait un beau mélange. 

La bibliothèque est un bel édifice plus récent selon moi. Elle compte plus de 15 millions d'ouvrages. Harvard possède donc  la plus importante bibliothèque universitaire du monde.

Juste devant, on voit des gens se faire prendre en photo devant la statue de John Harvard. Son pied en bronze est rendu luisant par les frottements. 

Nous nous sommes promené sur le campus car aucune visite intérieure n’est permise.

Plusieurs président américains et des lauréats du prix Nobel ont fréquenté l'endroit. 

nous avons bien aimé cette visite, ce moment de détente, de calme et de nature.

title: 停車位很難找
text: 地理位置方便，周邊吃喝玩樂的也不少，校區整體來說不大，適合散步式的觀光，如果開車來需要多花時間找車位

title: Самый известный университет
text:
Я побывала в Кембридже и посетила известны и старейший Гарвадский университет. Занимает большую территорию,пускают на территорию туристов. На территории находится статуя Гарварда,большая библиотека,кампусы ,учебные корпуса ,большая парковая зона.Большое количество белок ,много 
 необычных деревьев.Колокола звонницы университета отлиты в  России в Воронеже.Все постройки из красного кирпича.Вообщем не плохое место прогуляться.

title: Fundamental ir para conhecer
text: Caminhar pela universidade e arredores foi muito bom para conhecer o clima da deste lugar tão conhecido no mundo todo.

title: One of The Best and The Oldest University in the World
text:
Harvard University merupakan salah satu University tertua di Amerika yang didirikan oleh John Harvard. 

Suhu udara yang diperkirakan “hanya” 3 derajat anjlok menjadi 0 derajat padahal matahari bersinar dengan sangat cerahnya.
Di dalam halaman universitas Harvard terdapat patung perunggu dari John Harvard sang pendiri. Saya  heran, kenapa sepatu patung tampak kuning mengkilat sedangkan patungnya berwarna bronze. Ternyata ada kepercayaan bhw siapa yang mengelus sepatu patung John Harvard bakalan diterima di Harvard. Suatu kepercayaan aneh, tapi peserta tour banyak yang berfoto sambil memegang sepatu Sang Pendiri. 

Kampus harvard yang masih sepi karena baru jam 8.30 pagi membuat kami leluasa berfoto di sudut kampus yang instagramable itu.

title: Sonho de universidade!
text: Em Cambridge, procure pela Harvard Square. Chegando lá, fácil de localizar o Centro de Informações. Ali, uma simpática senhora dará um mapa de Harvard e do MIT e algumas orientações para o passeio. Logo ao lado fica o Harvard Yard, entrando nele, é possível conhecer uma parte do campus, que é enorme. Tudo muito organizado, limpo e bonito. Fora do campus, muitos cafés e restaurantes onde indico uma parada para um lanche.

title: Fantástico ♡
text: Amei lugar é grande bastante espaço ate mesmo para andar de bicicleta o dia que fomos estavam em formatura todos felizes e lindos. Muito organizado limpo e seguro qualquer pessoa pode entrar ali vale a pena.Reserve ao menos uma hora para esse local.

title: Universidade Linda
text: Não sei se pela fama ou pelos filmes, mas tinha um sonho de conhecer essa universidade, fiquei encantada com a visita é simplesmente enorme, nunca imaginei que era do tamanho que é. Um passeio que com certeza quem vem a Boston tem que fazer. Impressionante a organização.

title: Emblemático e Histórico!
text: Um campus enorme! Repleto de estudantes e turistas, muita história e tradição envolve uma das universidades mais famosas do mundo. Celebridades e nomes conhecidos estudaram e ainda estudam lá! Se estiver em Boston pegue o metro e visite Cambridge, Harvard.

title: Cambridge
text: Vale a visita à Harvard quando estiver em Boston. Chega- se facilmente de metrô pela linha vermelha desde o centro de Boston. É fácil acessar a pé o complexo de prédios históricos da universidade bem como os arredores com livrarias, cafés, lanchonetes e lojas de souvenirs.

title: Conheça este ícone mundialmente famoso
text: A pouca distância de Boston fica a cidade de Cambridge, que é onde se localiza esta famosíssima Universidade. Você pode andar pelo campus por conta própria ou através de passeios guiados, já que não se pode atrapalhar os alunos perguntando coisas acerca do campus. Não esqueça de passar a mão no pé do fundador para, como diz a superstição, seus filhos tenham chance maior de estudar nesta famosa e caríssima universidade. Caminhe tranquilamente pelo campus e conheça, além da amior biblioteca do mundo, o primeiro computador da IBM. Na saída, passe em uma das muitas lojas para levar lembranças com o nome desta universidade.

title: Passeio inesquecível em Cambridge
text:
Passeamos por Harvard Square e depois entramos pelos portões da universidade.
